description:
Education Alliance Finland provides a science-based quality standard and certification for learning solutions. We help EdTech companies to validate their solution's learning impact and support schools to choose the products with a proven positive impact on learning. 

Our Evaluation Method is an academically sound approach to evaluating a product‚Äôs pedagogical design from the viewpoint of educational psychology. Through our evaluation, you get feedback and evidence of the product's learning effectiveness. 

EdTech industry stakeholders around the world trust Education Alliance Finland to ensure solutions are independently certified to high-level quality standards.

V√•r ambisjon er √• utgi de beste videokursene innenfor alle omr√•der hvor folk ettersp√∏r oppl√¶ring. Alle l√¶rer raskest p√• sitt morsm√•l. Studenter. Medarbeidere. Ledere. Sustainable Brand Index‚Ñ¢ measures and analyses how sustainability affects branding, communication and business development. With the help of nearly 70 000 consumers across 8 countries, the study measures and analyses over 1 500 brands across 35+ industries on sustainability.

ArcticStartup is an independent technology company that reports on digital startups and growth entrepreneurship from the Nordic and Baltic countries. Our goal is to provide exceptional coverage of the news and trends needed to support a developed entrepreneurship community in Northern Europe.

ArcticStartup was founded in 2007 and is currently led by Jan Ameri and Vedat √ñndas. Our headquarters are located in Helsinki, Finland, however, we cover the startup scenes of Finland, Sweden, Norway, Denmark, Iceland, Estonia, Latvia, Lithuania and Russia.

Our aim is to encourage entrepreneurship and to promote connectedness in the Nordic and Baltic regions. To do so we have our media arm, events and a number of very exciting plans for expansion.

We continuously gather tens of thousands of readers from over 130 countries, giving the region's startups a media channel for getting global recognition.

Our flagship event Arctic15 gathers an international crowd of investors, startups, scaleups, corporates and influencers to Helsinki every spring.

If you want to share your news with us, please send us a tip through http://tip.arcticstartup.com

www.arcticstartup.com

We‚Äôre building a sustainable brand that people can trust, now and always. We do this by starting with what goes closest to our skin and what we wear the most. We create innovative sustainable products and build a community that celebrates and supports environmental activism and more responsible living. Through education on our online platforms, our customers are learning how to be better consumers - together with us.

Low Impact
We put sustainability at the core of everything we do. We‚Äôve invested in a green European supply chain to minimise our waste, water, and energy footprint - and by working with the highest globally certified sustainable standards for materials and production. We use sustainability as a core focus - not just as a superficial ‚Äúnice to have‚Äù. Most importantly we invest in the people and the knowledge that makes this fashion revolution possible.

Activism
We over invest in a more sustainable supply chain and in our own sustainable innovation, and we inspire activism by supporting important environmental causes. We always explain the how and why - and communicate with our customers and followers about doing what is right.

Transparency
We believe in showing the true impact of fashion - and always displaying information about where we make our clothes. In order to show the environmental impact to the customer - we‚Äôve developed our own Impact Index - which is a tool for measuring the true cost of fashion. This tool calculates the total savings for water, waste, CO2, chemicals and energy by comparing our supply chain against the typical industry practices.
_x0003_
Honesty
We‚Äôre building a brand that people can trust now and forever by going the extra mile and always making things right (and letting our customers and followers know what is going wrong). We want to be a brand that feels so human you would actually want to be friends with them.

Redoxme AB was founded in July 2015 in Norrk√∂ping, Sweden. It is an outcome of an entrepreneurial process based on the exploitation of academic technology at Link√∂ping University.

We provide laboratory instrumentation that enables simultaneous in-situ measurements of a number of signals (electrochemical, optical, thermal and other) on thin film and membrane materials. So what we are actually doing is creating an added value for existing laboratory facilities. An extension that combines many measurement techniques. But at the same time, we promote best practice in measurements and data analysis and we impose a concrete standardization in the field of material science. In practice, we are taking needs and opinions of scientist to create new methods that actually benefit to the whole research community. 

Our unique research/business environment consists of many actors from research and industry including Laboratory of Organic Electronics at Link√∂ping University, RISE Acreo AB and PEA-Manufacturing.

Tise is a Norwegian, fast-growing software company with an experienced team. We do everything from coding to design and business development in-house. 

Our main focus is the app for iOS and Android called Tise. Tise (as in "advertise"‚Äã) is a marriage between Instagram and Craigslist for selling and discovering second hand fashion, interior and furniture. 

We believe that second hand trade is an important key to make the world more sustainable. However, even though most people acknowledge this, their barriers are still too high to take action, and they still have too many nice things just laying around unused. To sell your items through a traditional classified service is a timely process and for many it is embarrassing or even stigmatic.

We believe that everyone wants to be a part of the green movement and just needs a little motivation and the right tool to get going. Tise increases your incentives for selling in a fun and inspiring way, while on the other hand lets you go second-hand treasure hunting in your own neighbourhood every day.

Videoly is the easiest way for online retailers to get hand-picked and automatically embedded product videos to online stores üé•‚ú®

üõí For retailers

Videoly sources existing video content such as reviews, presentations, unboxing, how-tos, from YouTube and directly from brands. User-generated content is also covered. Videos are embedded directly to online stores‚Äô product pages.

Before being linked to a product page, all videos are validated by a human viewer to ensure they‚Äôre suitable. 

üè∑ For brands

Videoly ensures brands‚Äô own videos are efficiently distributed to online retailers‚Äô product pages. It lets brands take control of how and where their videos are shown and gets brand videos to exactly where they should be - next to the add-to-cart button on a reseller‚Äôs online store.



‚úÖ Increased sales: Product videos increase conversion rate by an average of 34%.

‚úÖ Enhanced customer experience: Increased video coverage gives consumers richer product information.

‚úÖ SEO ranking: Consumers stay longer on pages with video, boosting time spent on site and Google hits.

‚úÖ Zero hassle: Videoly is fully automated. We add thousands of videos without any manual work required from users.

‚úÖ Replicate the in-store experience online: Nothing beats actually seeing a product in action.

‚úÖ Reduced return rate: Through video, consumers are able to make more informed purchase decisions, thus lowering product returns.

‚úÖ Keep control of your content: Videoly means your videos are shown in the optimal position on resellers‚Äô pages.

NorthQ is a leading-edge PropTech company that delivers a wide range of building and energy management solutions for the real estate sector.

With in-house developed hardware, software and cloud products, NorthQ covers all the steps needed for the reduction of energy waste, CO2 emissions and operational inefficiency across any number of properties. 
With this ability to provide a 360¬∞solution that follows the explicit needs of our customers, we continuously work towards transforming building data into valuable insights that drive savings.

NorthQ was awarded by the United Nations with the Sustainable Development Goals Tech Award in 2019, which was an international recognition that our solutions have the potential to leave a positive economic, social and environmental impact across industries. 

Since then we have been providing this mix of IoT, hardware, software, big data, machine learning and artificial intelligence which inspires our customers to understand exactly how their buildings are performing. In this way, companies can use their resources more responsibly- towards their business, communities and the environment.

INTRODUCING ROTATE

Aerocrine AB is a medical products company focused on improved management and care of patients with inflammatory airway diseases such as Asthma. Within this sector, Aerocrine is the world leader. Aerocrine markets NIOX MINO¬Æ and NIOX VERO¬Æ, , which enables fast and reliable point-of-care measurement of airway inflammation. Aerocrine is based in Sweden with subsidiaries in the US, Germany, Switzerland and the UK.

Simris Alg is a biotechnology company, engaged in research, development and production of bioactive substances from microalgae, for nutraceutical, cosmeceutical and pharmaceutical applications. Our technology provides access to bioactive substances with novel functions, while replacing unsustainable raw materials from endangered marine species and ecosystems. Our first commercialised range is a series of omega-3 health supplements marketed under our own Simris¬Æ brand.

Simris¬Æ Algae Omega-3 is Sweden‚Äôs first locally farmed, environmentally caring, ethical and fully plant-based marine omega-3 EPA & DHA. Simris¬Æ Algae Omega-3 is a superior and sustainable alternative to fish oil, boasting unparalleled product quality and outstanding product design.

We have received numerous awards for entrepreneurship, communication, engineering excellence, and environmental sustainability, as well as attention from international and Swedish press. Our vision is to be a beacon for positive change in business. 

Our headquarters and algae farm are located in Hammenh√∂g, in Sweden‚Äôs sunny √ñsterlen. Our commercial department is based in Stockholm. 

Simris Alg is a public company and our stock is traded on the Nasdaq First North stock exchange (FNSE:SIMRIS B)

RECCO AB produces and sells search technology for avalanche rescue and search and rescue operations in the outdoors. The technology was invented by Magnus Granhed, the founder and owner of RECCO AB, in the 1980s. Today the RECCO system is a global standard for avalanche rescue and is utilized by professional rescuers worldwide. The two-part technology consists of RECCO reflectors that are integrated into consumer products as apparel, helmets, protection gear, and boots. The RECCO¬Æ detectors are used by professional rescuers to search for and find people equipped with RECCO reflectors. As a global system RECCO AB works closely with rescuers from many different countries and distributes RECCO reflectors to outdoor brands worldwide.

Made for women, by women, in all their glorious shapes and ages. R/H collections represent a unique collage of Nordic minimalism, captivating prints, practical, feminine cuts and a certain spirit of northern, forest magic, all of which come together to create effortless, easy-to-wear pieces that will last well beyond this season's trends.

Hanna Riihel√§inen and Emilia Hernesniemi founded R/H in 2010, in Helsinki Finland, after working in different areas of fashion and design. Born out of a swimwear obsessed founder in an office in Stockholm, Sweden, Elsa & Rose Swimwear has now reached endless customers around the globe. Today, our teams are based in Stockholm and California.

A Multifunctional Fairytale

There once was a Danish mother, who wished for more comfortable settings while interacting with her baby boy during tummy time. However, she found that the bed was too soft, the floor was too hard, and there was something not quite right about all the surfaces she tried. No suitable underlay was pleasant enough to lie on for both her and her baby. Finally, she decided to design her own playmat and not only did it solve her problem, it also turned out to be a great tool for stimulating her son‚Äôs motor development and a way of strengthening their mutual bond.  It became so popular amongst her friends and family, that she soon found herself producing duplicates of the design. From there, it did not take long before she realised the potential of this versatile piece of furniture, and that was the beginning of by KlipKlap‚Äôs multifunctional journey. 

Today, the original design has developed into a full range of products that are being distributed to children and their conscious parents worldwide.

companyName: C A L I S S
description:
CALISS is a Stockholm based online lifestyle brand offering contemporary workwear for today's modern woman. The brand was officially launched online in 2014  to offer high-quality clothes with a contemporary, tailored and feminine aesthetics that are both travel friendly and designed for the work to evening wardrobe.

CALISS'‚Äã vision centers around effortless style and the collection consists of modern still timeless pieces that can easily be combined to facilitate the life of today's busy woman on the go.

Sustainable fashion brand house.

A committee is defined as a group of delegates dedicated to considering, investigating and acting on a particular matter.

The matter at hand for Committee XXIV is to create a new platform for slower and more thoughtfully and ethically manufactured fashion. Behind the boutique fashion group you will find founder Henriette Pieszak and a team of specialists committed to researching, testing and innovating to achieve their joint vision in close collaboration with hand-picked suppliers.

Today Committee XXIV counts the three specialized denim ateliers: Pieszak, IVY Copenhagen, and Tomorrow. With Pieszak being the first brand to receive the Nordic Swan Ecolabel, we consider ourselves pioneers in sustainable fashion. And although sustainability can be an uphill battle it is a fast-developing area, where our focus through more than ten years keeps paying off.

Craft is at the heart of everything we do. With every decision we make, we focus on details and honor aesthetics. Every well-fitting garment is in the end, put on by a satisfied customer. To us, craft means constructing garments that accentuate and fit real bodies. It means choosing high-quality fabrics. Not just some of the time, but every single time. The best kind of fashion happens when beauty is backed up by functionality.

Ebba Biotech provides tools for optotracing ‚Äì an innovative visualization method developed by scientists for scientists.

Optotracing as a method has been developed by a team of researchers from Karolinska Institute, KTH Royal Institute of Technology and Link√∂ping University in Sweden and is a result of many years of cutting-edge nanoscience and organic chemistry research.

Use our optotracers/fluorescent tracer molecules to search, detect and visualise macromolecular structures; we offer three product families:

Amytracker ‚Äì Amyloids and other protein aggregates.
For researchers and physicians to gain a deeper understanding of many neurodegenerative disorders, including Alzheimer‚Äôs disease.

EbbaBiolight ‚Äì Bacteria & biofilm.
For hospitals and microbiology laboratories, as well as in industry with high demands to detect bacterial contamination and biofilm formation.

Carbotrace ‚Äì Composition of bio-based materials.
For detailed and specific anatomical mapping of plants to fully understand their composition. For analysis of polysaccharides for optimization of production and/or recycling of any bio-based material including bio-fuels.

We push the boundaries of the film and camera industry, by empowering the new generation of filmmakers with better tools for content creation. 

Our first product is the Wiral LITE, the first ever portable, affordable and user friendly cable camera kit makes it easy to capture unique cinematic angles when filming. This product was launched on Kickstarter.com in October and during that 4 weeks campaign Wiral pre-sold for $1 million USD.

World of TRE, with a portfolio of 500+ design brands, is Finland‚Äôs largest platform for exporting and selling Nordic design. As a retail platform, World of TRE‚Äôs aim is to make Nordic lifestyle and happiness, as well as great Nordic design available globally. In the World of TRE‚Äôs strategy, the omnichannel shopping experience is the future and good design is for everyone.

The sales collection of furniture, fashion, and home decoration reflect the company‚Äôs values; good design, beauty,  and transparency. The carefully curated and unique but plentiful selection of brands include both well-known classics and new emerging designers. All designs are originals from well-known and awarded designers and are made to last a lifetime. 

The Finnish company works together with the best local partners to reach the right audience and top locations. World of TRE‚Äôs large portfolio of brands enables carefully curated offering for different locations and audiences.

Korea is World of TRE‚Äôs first international market. World of TRE‚Äôs first project in Korea was presenting 100 Finnish design companies in the TRE Christmas Market in Seoul in December 2017. At the moment, TRE has a shop in Dongdaemun Design Plaza mall (Salimteo) and in the fall, World of TRE is also opening an online store for the Korean market. 

In Japan, World of TRE will open a permanent store. TRE Store will be located in Mets√§ Village next to the world‚Äôs largest Moominvalley Park in Hanno, near Tokyo.

The bbhugme Pregnancy Pillow was created for a single reason: to help make mums and babies happier by keeping them more comfortable. 

We do this through a simple but powerful idea: a pillow that helps mother and baby sit, lie and sleep comfortably throughout pregnancy and early childhood. The company is built on our Scandinavian values and medical professional experience from chiropractors.
bbhugme was created by three chiropractors from Norway, Hilde, Ann Kristin and Elisabeth, who shared a deep interest in caring for pregnant women, moms and babies. They saw many teary, sleep-deprived women who were suffering from pelvic and back pain before, during and after pregnancy. The three realized that the women needed even more support and care ‚Äì a long-lasting, take-home solution that could support them beyond the care they got at the clinics. This was the origin of the bbhugme pillow.

A better pillow
The three chiropractors worked with designers to develop a unique pillow that mothers could properly count on for support. The pillow evolved from focusing on the details that matters. The optimal shape, filled with a specific type of mircobeads, gives provides sturdy, but flexible support for every body type. 

After the launch in 2013, bbhugme has won several awards in Norway and UK.

Ramsign offers authentically designed, hand-stenciled enamel signs featuring original design, and a thick and glossy enamel. All our enamel signs including house numbers, name plates, address plaques, are backed with a lifetime warranty and a money back guarantee.

The hand-made stenciling, and the fat, glossy enamel, are important characteristics, and the very soul of the traditionally produced enamel signs from us. 

Our personalized enamel signs are designed for individuals who want to decorate their homes, businesses that value a unique identity, and anybody who shapes the way we experience public spaces. For more information visit us at https://ramsign.com

AutoSock is the market leading and highest certified textile traction device for vehicles. Our products are available for cars, trucks and forklifts. AutoSock is used for a variety of vehicles from firetrucks and ambulances to public transportation services and airport pushbacks. Between our brands AutoSock and SnowGecko we cover 98% of the commercial tire size market. Our products are available in more than 60 countries. 

We invented the snow sock in 1996 and we were the first to manufacture a textile alternative to traditional snow chains. We went through extensive research and development to deliver the most technologically advanced solution to a simple challenge: winter driving safety. Therefore we collaborated directly with leading automotive manufacturers and international certification bodies.

AutoSock was incorporated in 1998, and became a Fred Olsen company in 2001. We are based in the headquarter of Fred. Olsen & Co. in Oslo, with additional locations in Spain, Germany and France.

Save the Orangutan works to save the endangered orangutan and its rainforest habitat.

We support the rescue and translocation of wild orangutans whose forest habitat has been destroyed and the rehabilitation of orphaned orangutans that ‚Äî without our help ‚Äî would die or be sold into the illegal pet trade. 

Our goal is for as many orangutans as possible to be released back into the wild, where they belong and to protect wild orangutans and their rainforest home.

To protect the orangutan and the rainforest we rely entirely on donations.

Eero Aarnio is the Finnish designer and innovator responsible for some of the most recognisable and best loved pieces of furniture of the last century. Fuelled by his lifelong enthusiasm for fresh ideas and new ventures, we have brought these iconic designs back to life under the label, Eero Aarnio Originals.

At the heart of Eero Aarnio Originals is Eero himself. Not just his designs but his family, his home, his life. Through our brand we are able to recreate these stories in a new universe while remaining true to the philosophy of the man himself. We are not just making furniture: we are sharing the stories behind the designs, issuing an invitation to discover Eero‚Äôs world.

Eero has become well known for pioneering the use of plastic and fiberglass in furniture design, and his iconic creations have led to a multitude of imitations. But we are determined to reconnect the designs with their founder, an endlessly innovative, imaginative creator and craftsman.

Eero Aarnio pieces are each characters in their own right, with their own life stories and personalities. They have been designed from a place of love and optimism; shaped by gut feeling, curiosity and imagination.

DRAKENBERG SJ√ñLIN is one of the most influential jewelry brands on the Swedish market. Besides their own shop in Stockholm they have over 100 retailers in Sweden as well as in Norway, England and Germany.

COMPANY VALUES

TIMELESSNESS. Nature is, despite its shifts in seasons and constant surprise, a symbol for timelessness. Where a leaf has grown and then fallen to the ground, a new leaf will grow again. It stands for endless change that never stops to evoke feelings. A piece of jewellery from drakenberg sjoÃàlin can be picked up and worn again and again, no matter where or when.

SIMPLICITY. There is a strength that shouldn‚Äôt be overworked or overstated. Strength in that which can stand on it‚Äôs own but also be a part of something bigger. A DRAKENBERG SJ√ñLIN jewellery should always add that little extra without overshadowing the wearer‚Äôs own personality

RAW ELEGANCE. When the effortless of nature‚Äôs asymmetry meets modern design philosophy a selfevident and urban naturalness emerges. DRAKENBERG SJ√ñLIN stands for raw elegance that combines classical with innovation.

THOUGHTFULNESS. A piece of jewellery is something personal and, if loved, will follow a person throughout life and then live on through next generations. Therefore jewellery has a history and says something about the wearer. For DRAKENBERG SJ√ñLIN it is important to put a lot of attentions into details, so that each piece of jewellery will be a comfortable, beautiful, uncomplicated and beloved friend to join you on the journey of life. Just like the intricate pattern of the leaf that keeps fascinating through out time.

Jazzhus Montmartre is the historic jazz hotspot of Copenhagen, presenting world class live jazz at the original intimate venue where it all started in 1959 at Store Regnegade 19A (Great Rain Street) in the heart of the Danish capital.

From 1959-1976, the club made jazz history as the European home for jazz giants Dexter Gordon, Ben Webster, Stan Getz, Kenny Drew and many other masters of the 60's and 70's.

They all moved to Copenhagen because of the special atmosphere of Montmartre. The club got under their skin with its special ambiance and extraordinary people.

The photo on the left is from a Playboy Magazine story in 1964 showing the intense admiration at Montmartre for Dexter Gordon.

While living in Copenhagen, the great American jazz icons educated a whole generation of Danish jazz masters, including the famous Danish bass players Niels-Henning √òrsted Pedersen, Mads Vinding, Jesper Lundgaard and Bo Stief, drummer Alex Riel, and trumpeter Palle Mikkelborg.

LOOW is a Danish clothing brand, specialized in making merinowool garments of the highest quality. Through vast knowledge, a personal approach and attention to detail, we aim to make the best product on the market. LOOW was founded in 2014 by Anders Lorentzen, a former Special Operation Forces operator, and conceived on his hands-on learnings through seven years in the force.

LOOW represents a unique approach to clothes making. One that doesn‚Äôt pay attention to a fast-paced fashion industry, but instead focus solely on quality, durability and versatility, and the idea that we are supposed to depend on and demand more from what we wear. An important aspect of everyday life working under harsh conditions in high pressure situations. 

The direct inspiration behind the first ever LOOW product was a middle blue Special Operation Forces standard issue wool base layer. A subtle, slim-fit T-shirt merging the uncompromised functionality of combat gear with a timeless civil look. The versatility of the merino wool quickly made this piece of military equipment a trusted companion. Both in the scorching heat of Afghanistan, the Scandinavian winter and anywhere in between.

The designer behind MALLING LIVING, Rikke Malling
Rikke Malling is the owner and designer behind MALLING LIVING, but she also has a background as restaurant owner and is educated sommelier. In 2005, she and her husband, Thorsten Schmidt, opened the gourmet restaurant, Malling & Schmidt, which they ran for a decade. Coming from a family of architects, Rikke Malling has always had a great fondness of interior design, and since the opening of the two restaurants, she has styled, designed and produced most of the interior of the restaurants to ensure that the overall expression was exactly like she wanted. Dundas Footwear was established to produce quality footwear of the highest order, but also to utilize the knowledge and experience that still exist in Europe. As more and more factories are closed down or moved to more cost-effective countries, the knowledge and tools for making products by traditional methods are dwindling. The Dundas clan name was chosen not only because it is Liam`s old family name, but because it represent hundreds of years of continuous history under the clan motto "Essayez", or "Try". The Dundas tartan is used in the heel straps on our boots, as a reminder of Dundas`great history, and to remind us to always try our best.
True quality is a result of a long and painstaking process, not just the PR-drivel called "perceived quality". True quality is the customers reward for paying for a product that is made with pride, from the tannery to the workshop.
Our reward is seeing a happy customer that wears his boots with pride. A pair of Dundas is the beginning of a long friendship.
We believe in happiness

√Ålafoss - tradition of quality since 1896. When √Ålafoss was established at the end of the 19th century, it was marked as the true beginning of Iceland's wool industry. √Ålafoss is located in the old factory house by the waterfall √Ålafoss that was used to drive the mills of the old factory. There you can find a great selection of the popular traditional Icelandic wool sweater ("lopapeysa"), knitting wool yarn and almost any wool product you can think of as well as experience this important side of Iceland's industrial history in the form of the factory building and an exhibit of selection of old knitting machinery and photographs from the early days. 

Among √Ålafoss' satisfied customers are prominent world leaders such as Hillary Clinton and Ronald and Nancy Reagan, whose thank-you notes are displayed in the store in Iceland. Not to forget the world's first female head of state, Iceland's own Vigd√≠s Finnbogad√≥ttir.

Bahini is a Swedish scarf brand that was founded in Stockholm in 2016. The scarves are designed in Sweden and handmade by women at carefully selected Fair Trade certified suppliers. Each handcrafted scarf is unique and made with plant-based sustainable materials and dyes to ensure that Mother Earth loves it just as much as we do. 

Our story began in 2014 at a safe house for young girls in Kathmandu, Nepal. It was there and then our mission was born: to empower a bahini, which means little sister in Nepali, with the freedom of choice and to raise awareness about sex-trafficking. With each scarf sold, we support a bahini in need with a scholarship, and through our Fair Trade suppliers we provide our older sisters with training and employment so they too can become independent and live a life free from enslavement. 

Join our #mybahini tribe and help us spread awareness to empower even more girls.

HIT THE HAY is a Swedish company that set out to slap our industry in the face! But you know, in a gentle way, with a pillow or something... Our industry has since long been dominated by Cotton, a fabric that drains our planet from water and polluting it with harsh chemicals. We said enough! And started HIT THE HAY. 

Our promise is to offer people an eco-friendly yet far more greater option when it comes to beddings. We believe that being environmentally conscious should be rewarded, not the other way around. Our Lyocell fabric derives from rapidly growing eucalyptus trees that grow without artificial irrigation, synthetic pesticides or gene modification. The wood pulp is processed with non-toxic organic chemicals in a closed loop cycle that recycles 99,5% of all process chemicals and reuses water.  

Beyond being eco-friendly, Lyocell has a bunch of other great advantages. This super breathable fabric is smoother than silk and featherlike soft to the touch, it's anti-bacterial, hypoallergenic, thermo-regulating, and moisture-wicking, making it the ideal choice for something to spend 1/3 of your life in.

We are computer vision researchers and entrepreneurs from Denmark, who for many years struggled to find high-quality calibration targets that were affordable for CV labs and companies. After evaluating different processes for calibration target manufacturing in terms of accuracy, price, and versatility, we found a reliable process for medium to large size calibration targets that are accurate, flat and very stiff. We established Calib.io I/S to make these products available to others facing the same challenges.

Accurate and robust calibration targets are essential for 3D scanning and photogrammetry purposes. Our targets are compatible with OpenCV, MATLAB, CharuCo, Agisoft Photomodeler, MVTec Halcon and more.

Our checkerboard calibration targets also allow professional photographers and videographers to create accurate lens profiles for Adobe CC.

All of our calibration targets are made from durable aluminium/LDPE material which offers excellent flatness and stiffness, while being lightweight and suitable even for prolonged outdoor use. Additionally, the composite material offers excellent thermal stability and corrosion resistance.

Try the free online pattern generator and test your calibration pattern on standard paper, then order a highly accurate and robust target. For completely customised calibration patterns, please send us your design as a PDF file.

Jewelry by Grundled is rooted in the desire of founder Helle Just Weiling to immerse herself in the detailed work of putting together the miniature parts of each piece.

Wood, steel and colored brass come together in minimalistic expressions of geometry.

The pieces enclose the nature of the north in light designs creating a connection between the jewelry and its origin. To carry Jewelry by Grundled is to carry nature with you.

Grundled is the Danish word for the grammatical subject, and the name indicates profound personal relations between the maker, her products and her craft. The subject is the matter, the foundation and the thing that drives us forward.

Jewelry by Grundled offers unique but highly affordable products. Every piece is crafted by hand in Denmark and made with a true passion for simple aesthetics and the powerful beauty of the wood.

Helle Just Weiling

As a writer, I spent most of my time at my desk, hunched over my laptop in a caf√© rushing toward a deadline. I was the classic clich√©, coffee stains on papers, a half eaten sandwich, too many browsers open, and a whole lot of pain that I was too driven to pay attention to.

 Then it hit me. My neck hurt so much that it was hard to focus. I was always tired and my productivity decreased. I found myself often getting irritable for no reason.

Then, I started talking to people. They felt the same way. I was not alone. The Modern Setup was born to help me with my pain, but it‚Äôs so much more than that. This simple stand gave me so much freedom in my life that I can‚Äôt imagine life without it. I don‚Äôt want anyone else to either! I became more productive. I had more energy. I stopped having pain and even became a kinder, more compassionate person. The right people just started showing up in my life, and now The Modern Setup has freed so many people.

 I feel privileged to have played a part in that. And I‚Äôm grateful to wake up every morning and see what difference I can make in the lives of people, families, and businesses everywhere. My next question for you is what are you ready to free yourself from?

Kr√∂nleins Brewery is the oldest family-owned brewery in Sweden and one of the most renowned brewers in the world. Established in 1790 and located on the Swedish west coast since 1836, Kr√∂nleins specializes in lager type beers-- pilsner and dunkel--and has received many quality awards in the Brewing Industry International Awards (BIIA) and the DLG.  

The Kr√∂nlein family has a brewing tradition that stretches six generations back in time. In 1790, a Kr√∂nlein family member marked the start of the legacy and began brewing beer in Mainstockheim, Germany. The original brewing methods introduced 200 years ago have since provided the heart of Kr√∂nleins‚Äô brewing methodology. 

The will to maintain and honor the craftsmanship in brewing every beer to its right strength and flavor using only natural ingredients, is central to Kr√∂nleins‚Äô brewing philosophy. We have taken a firm step away from commercial, artificial brewing methods and we are very proud to operate under the Naturbryggt¬Æ certificate. Kr√∂nleins believe in brewing as an uninterrupted process in which each beer reaches its optimal state without additives, preservatives, and water dilution. Our philosophy gives the beer an unbeatable character, a complex depth of tastes, and an outstanding drinking experience. 

Kr√∂nleins is the world‚Äôs most successful non-German brewery in what is known to be the strictest quality assessment of beer, the German DLG. In 2009, Kr√∂nleins was the first ever non-German brewery to be awarded with the Gold ‚ÄòPreis der Besten,‚Äô the most sought after and prestigious prize in the DLG for 10 consecutive years of brewing mastery. 

We hold several prizes from the International Brewing Awards‚ÄîThe World Championships for Beer‚Äîwith the latest addition to our prize collection in 2013. The successes of Kr√∂nleins show that a Swedish artisan brewery can meet and even surpass the standards of the international brewing elite.

Our heritage dates back to 1888 when Per Persson launched the leather brand S. P. Persson in Malung, Sweden. Per was an exceptionally talented businessman who managed to transform the leather industry by owning both factories and shops at the most prominent addresses in Stockholm and Gothenburg.

Five Seasons remains a family business, that still fosters the heritage of excellence that Per Persson established. Aiming to offer best value for money. Functional and fashionable clothes for all seasons.

- Our goal is, unlike the broad Danish coffee market, to  only  sell high quality and absolutely fresh roasted coffee.

There is a difference between coffee.

Kalaneuvos Oy, formerly known as V. Hukkanen Oy, has operated in fish industry since 1975 and is nowadays one of the biggest operators in the Finnish market. Our fish farming group is specialised in smolt production and trout farming. The Group has 30 fish farming plants in Finland and Sweden. Our fish farms can supply fresh trout to wholesalers and further processors throughout the year.

HUR - For Lifelong Strength

HUR, from Finland, specialise in providing smart (computerised) exercise solutions for the active-ageing, rehabilitation, and the inclusive wellness markets, worldwide.

With almost 30 years of experience, HUR offers premium-quality pneumatic strength training solutions, coupled with smart technology‚Ä¶in short, we promote the idea of maintaining, or (re)developing Lifelong Strength.

For example, 46% of those over 80 years old can't lift more than 5 kg. which impacts detrimentally on their ability to perform everyday activities effectively and with energy, to maintain their balance, and to live independently‚Ä¶yet this is not inevitable. Studies show that one of the most important factors in staying healthy and independent is to have good muscular condition‚Ä¶and this is reflected now in most health guidelines.

Our belief is that we are entitled to live a healthy and independent life, for as long as possible. Obesity, diabetes, depression, cardiac disease, and dementia provide enormous health challenges, but we need to confront these in new and proactive ways, to ensure our happiness, and reduce the strain on the public purse .

HUR is dedicated to contributing where we are best - in providing the best exercise solutions for preventive, rehabilitative and maintaining training - so that our customers can keep on doing their wonderful work, every day.

Delipap Oy (Ltd.) started from a simple thought; Mr. Raimo Nuortie's son, Oskari, had really sensitive skin as a baby, and the cloth diapers used at the time did not suit his delicate skin. Like every father, Raimo worried about his son‚Äôs well-being and decided to develop a new diaper that would suit even the baby‚Äôs sensitive skin. Raimo ended up patenting his idea and established a company of his own. 

Today we sell our high-class hygiene products for the needs of the entire family across Europe and Asia. Our product range has grown with us, and we are Finland's largest consumer goods manufacturer and home of trusted, high-quality brands, including Muumi Baby diapers, Vuokkoset¬Æ feminine hygiene products, Harmony¬Æ light incontinence and hospital care products and Helmi¬Æ cotton and care products, with loads more innovations to come. Our products are documented to be skin friendly and environmentally responsible. We fulfill the strict criteria of the Nordic Swan Ecolabel and the Finnish Skin, Allergy and Asthma Federation. For us, sustainability is integral to how we do business. With 7 billion people on our planet, the earth‚Äôs resources can be strained. This means sustainable growth is the only acceptable model of growth for our business.

Today, after 40 years since the company was found, the company is still owned by the same family and the third generation is already highly involved in the family business. The development and success of our brands is thanks to the innovative, dedicated and insightful minds of our people. We employ around 70 people in manufacturing, sales, marketing and R&D. We are proud to be the only Finnish manufacturer of hygiene products, and we're still growing. And that means we need more brilliant people who share our ambition, to join in with the next, most exciting, part of our story.

Costo is a combination of handicrafts, materials, a unique vision of style and strive for ecological, lasting solutions. All of this is wrapped into an all-encompassing idea of quality, which has been guiding us on everything we do since 2006 when we were found. 

Costo products are made to last - they are high-quality and timeless. The quality bases on the proper skills in handicrafts as well as on sustainable material choices. The fabrics and leathers are left-overs from furniture and fashion industry, cotton is either recycled or organic and the beanies are made of high-quality merino wool. 

Design of products are timeless and not tied on any certain era or style. Ecology is taken into account on local production. The products are made in Yliullava and Sastamala, Finland and in Tallinn, Estonia. Most of materials come from within EU, from Finland, Denmark and Italy.

For us at Costo, ecology, style and quality go hand-in-hand.

description:
1. WORKWEAR SERVICES 

When it comes to the safety of employees, our customers know that there are no shortcuts. They trust us to manage their workwear because we take complete responsibility for all activities associated with it.

The result? 

Time is freed-up for customers to concentrate on their business, space is gained to improve the working environment and capital is made available to help the business grow. Customers depend on our workwear to be as functional, reliable and protective as possible to help build a safe working environment.

2. MAT SERVICES

We provide floor protection mats, reducing the dirt brought into our customers premises and saving on overall cleaning costs.

Research has found that over 75% of the dust and dirt in buildings is walked in from outside, often amounting to several kilos of dirt every day. Floor protection mats trap this dirt and moisture, preventing it from being spread throughout the building. We launder your mats regularly, leaving them much fresher and smarter than simple vacuum cleaning can achieve.

Fat Lizard Brewing Co. is a Finnish indie brewery specializing in super fresh and drinkable American-style beers. We‚Äôre located in Otaniemi, in the very heart of Espoo. 

The love for fresh American ales ‚Äì and not getting them in Finland ‚Äì made us brew. The sharpest aromas of delicate hops disappear while shipping the beer intercontinentally. The only way to enjoy fresh and luscious IPA was to brew it ourselves here in Finland.

As the first commercial brewery ever in Espoo, the company was founded by four fellows ‚Äì Hessu, Topo, Topi and Eero ‚Äì in 2014 and has been operative since February 2015. Today the brewery staff includes 20 irreplaceable characters altogether.

Cembrit is one of the leading producers, distributors and developers of fibre cement building materials in Europe. Cembrit offers a wide range of products and solution for interior and exterior cladding as well as for roofing. The group employs about 1,100 dedicated people in production and sales companies in most European countries and it is owned by SoLix. In Finland we employ about 115 professionals.

A Good Home For Brands

Conaxess Trade is Europe‚Äôs leading independent distributor and has a presence in six countries (Central Europe with Austria and Switzerland; Nordics with Denmark, Finland, Norway and Sweden). Based on extensive experience of all the key distribution channels and product categories, Conaxess Trade is able to provide manufacturers of FMCG brands easy access to markets with a total of more than 40 million consumers.

The flexible value chain of Conaxess Trade encompasses a range of tailor-made, modular distribution and marketing solutions for international brand owners. These include professional services in the fields of marketing, category management, key account management, point-of-sale services, market intelligence, purchasing, logistics, warehousing, co-packing, distribution and customer services.

Eevia Health is the producer of 100% organic natural extracts from plants growing in the pristine wild Finnish forests of the Arctic Circle. All wild raw materials such as lingonberry, bilberry, chaga and pine bark are hand-picked and carefully processed into highest-quality, standardised extracts in Eevia‚Äôs own production facilities in Finland. These extremely potent ingredients are a perfect fit in dietary supplements, functional beverages and superfoods, to support healthier and happier lives. Short value chain controlled by Eevia together with organic certification gives assurance of the origin, authenticity and traceability.

Eevia Health holds the Euroleaf organic certification, making Eevia‚Äôs entire product portfolio of wild Arctic plant ingredients organic-certified. Health is never compromised, as Eevia‚Äôs organic certified Arctic plant extracts contain extremely high and standardized amounts of active nutrients such as polyphenols, flavonoids, antioxidants and beta-glucans. The increasing science is suggesting that these components may contribute to stronger immunity, reduced inflammation, healthier heart and improved metabolism. Eevia is continuously exploring new things that Arctic nature can offer, and further researching how their products can contribute to healthier lives.

Eevia Health is committed solely to natural and organic Arctic ingredients and to a stringent focus on sustainability.

Jymir Group, who operates in Finland under the name Kuntokauppa.fi and in Sweden under Sportproffsen.se is a family-owned fast-growing Nordic eCommerce-driven omnichannel sporting goods retailer founded in 2007. The group offers well-known and high-quality brands and in addition it develops own brands, such as FitNord and Medinor. In the selection you can find over 3500 high-quality electric-bikes, treadmills, crosstrainers, rowing machines and other cardio equipment as well as a comprehensive range of body care products, watersports, home training and gym equipment. The main target group is consumers, but the company serves many businesses too. In addition to eCommerce, there are two stores in Finland (Tampere and Vantaa Tammisto in the Helsinki area) and an office in Stockholm Sweden. A store unit will be launched in Stockholm in 2022.

The vision is to grow into the best company in the industry in the Nordic countries in terms of customer experience, employee experience, and profitable growth. At the core of the business model are strong eCommerce expertise, specialty store's level of service and demand-based product and selection development. The business is run by a dynamic culture that encourages achievement and continuous development and with the mission ‚Äì ‚Äúwellbeing for people‚Äù.

Stadin Panimo (roughly translates into Helsinki Downtown Brewery) is an innovative craft brewery located in Suvilahti, Helsinki, Finland. Stadin Panimo was founded in 1998. During the years we have made over 500 different beers and we are constantly testing different hops, malts, yeasts and beer styles. We have won many awards in different Finnish beer competitions. Our ambition is to make better beer every time in every batch. Stadin Panimo has also International orders for request.

Looking for local craft beer in Helsinki? You can try our latest beers by visiting our small beerhouse which is located right next to our brewery.

Mission

As pioneers and leading manufacturers of perfume free products our mission is to promote a different approach to professional hair care.
At Sim we work to inspire and encourage hairdressers to take a better care of themselves and their clients. With true dedication to our Clean Air Salon concept, experience and partnership with our clients, we thrive to revolutionize conventional approach to hairdressing, create a healthier working environment and offer high performance products.

Philosophy

‚Ä¢True enthusiasm for designing high standard salon products and environments
‚Ä¢Authentic interest in perfume free professional hair care products
‚Ä¢Genuine dedication to our partners' & customers' needs and their satisfaction

Being a Finnish company we make high quality standards a must with every product we create. Mixing it with our Scandinavian love for purity and harmony, and authentic interest in improving our clients working environment, we dedicate ourselves to designing high standard perfume free products and creating up-to-date in-salon solutions

Values

Maximum performance in everything we do and create
Our clients are our inspiration
We are partners
We work for a better air to breath

Food Business For Over 30 Years

Our journey in the Finnish food business started as pioneers in meat importing. As one of the very first companies, we introduced Finns to high-quality meats and international cuts that were never seen here before. Revolutionizing the meat selection and enriching the food culture was and still is our biggest passion.

Looking far into the future of food business means quality over quantity. Eating better food does good both on a personal and environmental level. With this in mind we source, offer and deliver the best possible products for our customers.

We cater to the Finnish food business together with our strong international partners. Our expertise in responsible sourcing, quality, and food safety is a top priority for use every day and our customers respect that.

About us:

Maler Oy is a Finnish family-owned company, and a forerunner of interior construction. Our main line of business is to manufacture interior products, made of wood or wood fibre boards, for both dry and wet indoor spaces. Our main products - interior panels, wall panels, and mouldings - offer easy ways of finishing the indoor surfaces.

We want constantly to develop our business and products, and help our customers to find new, high-quality solutions for finishing their interior and construction premises. Over the years we have noticed that the best product ideas come often when developed together with customers. Tailor-made production for our customers is everyday business in Maler Oy. 

Maler Oy uses PEFC-certified pine and spruce to manufacture interior mouldings and panels. In our modern painting lines, we can finish the surfaces with most of the usual treatments according to customers‚Äô requirements. The wood fibre boards, which we work with, are MDF, HDF, moisture resistant MDF or fire retardant MDF depending on the final purpose of use. Wood fibre products - interior mouldings, panels and wall panels - are wrapped with different kinds of finishing foils or genuine wood veneer. 

The following Maler products have been granted the best Finnish emission classification M1 of building materials: MDF panels, MDF and HDF interior wall panels and SPA moisture resistant MDF panels. ThermiSol Oy was founded in 1962 and specialises in the production and processing of EPS (expanded polystyrene). Until the year 1997 the company operated under the name Isora Oy. ThermiSol Oy is part of the international building material manufacturer and supplier Kingspan Group Plc.

The Panel unit produces THERMISOL sandwich panels that are manufactured in Sastamala. Half of the manufactured panels are exported to Scandinavia, the Baltic Countries and Russia.

ThermiSol Oy employs approximately 95 people and the turnover was 30 million euro in 2009.

The operational principle of ThermiSol is to produce THERMISOL products and services, which meet the requirements and expectations of our customers. Our management system fulfils the requirements of the ISO 9001:2008 and ISO 14001:2004 standards in addition to those stipulated in OHSAS 18001:2007.

The cement industry alone creates up to 7% of global greenhouse gas emissions. Replacing concrete with geopolymer concrete has the potential to cut CO2 emissions by up to 80%. This way we can accelerate the transition towards sustainable construction and a low carbon society.

Today, Firstbeat services are offered in more than 70 countries.

#YouHaveItInYou

Jungle Juice Bar is a Finnish smoothie chain, established in 2010. Offering is specialized in delicious plant based premium smoothies, juices and healthy shots. companyName: Sako Ltd - Part of Beretta Group
description:
ATTENTION TO DETAIL IS IN OUR NATURE

Sako is the world's most prestigious rifle and cartridge brand. Our acclaimed reputation, high quality products and credibility are rooted in our employees'‚Äã unique skills and pride in what they do.

Our history began when the company was founded in the early 1920s. Sako has come a long way from its early hand manufacture to today‚Äôs computer aided R&D and CNC manufacturing. Nevertheless, we have not forgotten the value of traditional gunsmith craftsmanship, which is why we still carry out certain critical steps ourselves.

At the turn of the millennium, Sako was honored to become a member of the Beretta Group, which gave access to new and advanced production methods enabling us to continuously refine our product development. In addition to rifles, Sako produces centerfire cartridges. We make more than 100 different loads in 35 popular calibers for different targets and hunting purposes. Making both rifles and cartridges is a matter of pride for Sako. Our mission remains to offer our customers the very best in accuracy and performance.

OUR VALUES:

INTEGRITY ‚Äì we work in harmony, respecting each other. We always look at the big picture.

COMMITMENT ‚Äì we honour the agreed decisions and rules of engagement and act accordingly.

OPENNESS ‚Äì we maintain an open flow of information and encourage interaction.

PASSION ‚Äì we have a strong desire to develop our operations, with our heart and professionalism.

Gold&Green Foods is a cross-cultural food tech company, selling and developing novel, delicious and sustainable plant protein foods. 

We combine the latest Nordic food science findings and the naturally nutritious and trendy Nordic ingredients with some specific Asian food technologies in our innovative products.

Honka - Wood living from Finland

The essence of Finnish happiness comes from having a close relationship with nature and its unique light. Our purpose at Honka is to bring the life force of the northern woods and sunshine into people‚Äôs lives. This is why we create healthy homes and buildings from renewable wood.

A tree that has grown in the northern woods is a work of art created by nature: it grows stronger in the extreme sub-zero conditions and stores in itself the light of the nightless summer nights. A Honka log home is a lasting legacy for future generations. Construction is the most environmentally conscious use of wood because as trees grow, they absorb carbon dioxide, which remains stored for the entire lifecycle of the building. Certified, renewable wood is a building material that is sustainable, durable and healthy ‚Äì and energising.

Ever since the Saarelainen brothers founded Honka in 1958, we have studied wood and learned to appreciate its uniqueness. Each Honka log home is not just a work of art created by nature, but a masterpiece of Finnish design craftsmanship. In Karstula, central Finland, we manufacture buildings that are good for people.

The Honka yellow is the colour of hope and joy for us. Nature teaches us to see the good in life and to understand that even the smallest of deeds make a difference. We want to help our customers achieve the dreams that matter the most to them. We are honoured to bring the life force of the northern woods.

Honka¬Æ is a registered trademark of Honkarakenne Plc. It encapsulates our family business‚Äôs expertise and love of log construction spanning more than 60 years. Our log houses have been sold the most in the world ‚Äì over 85,000 Honka buildings around the globe. We make sure that our patented Honka technology serves faultlessly in all climates and geographical circumstances, we are a global pioneer in modern log building.

Nature doesn‚Äôt need you. You need nature. 

Naava is a nature-inspired technology company from the Nordics. The global market leader in living green walls & biological indoor air purification with proprietary software & patented technology. We improve physical & mental health and connect you with nature. 

We have been recognized as one of Europe‚Äôs fastest-growing and hottest companies by Financial Times (2020), Inc (2018), and WIRED (2017). 

Naava creates the most compelling design furniture with living plants by combining nature, technology, and Scandinavian design. We are on a mission to re-seed the respect for nature and thus drive people and the planet towards healthier and more sustainable urban living. 

Experience the power of nature with Naava.

Heltti is Finland's largest company focused on supporting the vitality of knowledge workers.

With the Veri mobile app, users scan a wearable glucose sensor to get actionable insights and recommendations on nutrition and their lifestyle habits.

Hagl√∂fs comes from Sweden, a country of extreme weather and extensive landscape. Where rolling lowlands and running rivers give way to thick forests and snow-capped mountains. A place where the outdoors isn‚Äôt just a far-off place, it‚Äôs in the fabric of the brands culture and community. Hagl√∂fs explore with curiosity and a commitment to creating gear that will support anyone, anywhere on their outdoor adventure - from walking through the forest to reaching the peak of a mountain. 
An attitude of innovation is at the core of Hagl√∂fs‚Äô history. The brand was founded in 1914 by Wiktor Hagl√∂f, a visionary with a dream and a toolbox. A carpenter by trade, Wiktor was determined to create a backpack that would withstand the necessary journeys through the country, no matter the conditions. From humble beginnings, Hagl√∂fs‚Äô story evolved, and so did the offerings. Seeking constant progress, Hagl√∂fs have ventured into new territory, creating technical designs that set a new standard in craftsmanship and committing to do what can be done to ensure that the outdoors will still be there for future generations to explore. We have developed the only digital method of birth control cleared by regulators both in the US and in Europe. Effective, natural, and backed by clinical research - Natural Cycles has been cleared by the US FDA and CE marked in Europe. Today we have a growing user base, who are happy to have found a method of birth control that is right for them and that allows them to get to know their bodies and cycles. No matter what your choice is, we believe that every woman should know that understanding how your cycle works matters. 

Natural Cycles was created when our founders, Elina and Raoul, were in search of an effective method of natural birth control. Their journey took them from physics straight into health tech for women. The couple were unsatisfied with what they found, so they decided to apply their experience and knowledge in advanced mathematics and data analysis to develop a solution to meet their needs. This turned out to be an algorithm that detects and predicts ovulation and fertility.

In the early days, they used the algorithm for their own purposes but quickly realized that there was a vast unmet need for this type of method. They decided to develop a mobile app so women from all over the world could easily access and use Natural Cycles.

Our company has been up and running since 2013 and has been rapidly growing since our CE certification in February 2017. At Natural Cycles we are always looking for passionate talents to help us strive for change in such a complex, scientific, and controversial field. We have women's best interest at heart and work hard every single day to ensure that we provide the best possible solution. That‚Äôs why each and every team member is passionate about what we do.

Gathered from all corners of the world we are a tight-knit international team located right in the center of beautiful Stockholm. If you would like to join us, check our open job positions below, go ahead and connect with us.

A LOVE OF NATURE WITH AN URBAN PURPOSE 

If you‚Äôve been around long enough, your story tends to be rich in both experiences and achievements. This is certainly true for Tretorn, which was founded 1891. Although Tretorn can be found in stores all over the world, from Paris and New York to Tokyo and Berlin, Tretorn remains inherently Swedish. Drawing inspiration from the Nordic way of living, we fuse a love of nature with urban purpose. Our heritage and rich expertise in rubber-based products have given us the intrepidity to develop collections that rise to any rough weather occasion. 

Our first products were driven by functional needs: high-quality rubber galoshes primarily used by villagers, fishermen and the military. Then came the iconic tennis shoe. As sportswear became the height of fashion in the 1960s,it was clear that Tretorn could design shoes that were as popular on the pages of fashion magazines as they were on the tennis court. And we‚Äôve done whatever it takes, from pushing the boundaries of the technology to making rubber boots by hand to ensure that no shower gets in the way of the everyday life outside. The brand unites function with design and style, offering collections that embody an updated and modern timelessness. Decade after decade, we‚Äôve stood strong ‚Äì whatever the weather ‚Äì and developed products that are made for enjoying the outside.

CELEBRATES THE EVERYDAY LIFE OUTSIDE, IN CITIES, IN NATURE. ALWAYS WITH STYLE.

Sandqvist is a Stockholm-based brand which aims to become a leader when it comes to bags and accessories in the fashion industry. Challenging the role of functionality in design and practicing sustainability and respect for the environment at all times without compromising the aesthetics, Sandqvist places its core values as a lifestyle brand firmly at the forefront.

Sandqvist was founded in 2004, initially as an experimental design project by three childhood friends; Anton, Daniel and Sebastian. The brand grew organically as a response to the lack of well-crafted, design-led, functional bags on offer at the time and disrupted the status-quo on how practicality can go hand-in-hand with design. Staying true to their Scandinavian roots, the three founders still believe in Swedish values; sustainability and care for the environment, high-quality designs and an unbeatable approach to function. These principals are ever-present throughout every element of the collection and the brand is living proof all of these can be fused to create expertly-designed products at a reasonable price point.

As part of its continued international expansion strategy, Sandqvist is carried by a selected range of prestigious retailers ‚Äì including the likes of Le Bon MarcheÃÅ, KaDeWe, Liberty, END, Free People and Selfridges. In total the brand is carried at over 650 doors globally. The first-ever store opened in Stockholm, Sweden in November 2011. Followed by 7 stores, in Stockholm and Gothenburg, Sweden, London, England and Berlin, Germany. Today Sandqvist is represented in 35 countries, with the biggest markets being in the Nordics and Europe.

Bluewater is the Swedish company changing the way the world views water, by delivering the healthiest fresh drinking water around the world, and helping to eliminate the need for single-use plastic bottles. 

We believe the best water is sourced and purified in local communities, not bottled in plastic and transported from faraway places. 
Since 2013, we‚Äôve been purifying water using patented SuperiorOsmosis‚Ñ¢ technology ‚Äì technology so powerful it can expertly purify water from the Baltic Sea. 

We also empower businesses and our planet-conscious customers to consume their purified water with a fully plastic-free solution. For hydration at work, our innovative water purifiers provide up to 7,000 litres daily of the purest still and sparkling water with an impressive recovery rate of up to 60% ‚Äì so no need for bottled water. We also offer corporate glass and stainless steel water bottles, which can be branded with a company logo.

For hydration at home and on the go, our sleek reusable water bottles are durable, sustainable, and feature a stylish minimalist design. As part of our commitment to a cleaner planet, we also promise to remove 1kg of plastic waste from our world‚Äôs beaches for every Bluewater bottle sold.

The Bluewater Group is headquartered in its hometown of Stockholm, with regional offices across four continents.

Carex was established with a young and dynamic team in 2010, that adopted the principle of respect for nature and science. In 2018, the company moved its headquarters to Sweden and brought a new vision to the journey made at the source of nature and science.

Since its inception, Carex Sweden has been providing innovative and high-performing products without harming nature. In Sweden and Turkey; production facilities are keeping natural conditions, yet manufacturing effective skin & hair care products. Carex Sweden, offering products formulated with Sweden‚Äôs natural thermal water and cosmetics science, brings together nearly 100 types of endemic plants selected from organic sources in Sweden and the world with respect for biodiversity.

With this mission successfully carried out in nearly 35 countries, it meets the needs of hair and skin problems of consumers in different channels with chemical-free, herbal, and organic solutions.

Bionnex is the only product line in the "Dermo Organic"‚Äã category which offers 100 % organic solutions against hair and skin problems. As the world‚Äôs leading electric jetboard company, Radinn embodies the next-generation of water sports: a completely modular, 100% electric jetboard that lets you soar across the water at incredible speeds. 

Radinn started as a student project at Lund University in Sweden back in 2013. The prototype for our first electric jetboard was launched a few years later, with the Generation I line following in 2016. From there, Radinn‚Äîshort for radical innovation‚Äî went on to become the world‚Äôs first mass-produced jetboard company, completely disrupting the industry with our product's innovative design and technology.

We have since grown from a team of 8 engineers working out of a small office in Malm√∂ to a company of 70 plus employees working in offices throughout Sweden, Poland, Australia and the U.S. Our latest line of jetboards, Generation III, was launched in 2020. 

Our brand motto, Make Waves, celebrates the go-getters chasing their dreams and risk-takers swimming outside the lines. The thrill-seekers willing to dive in headfirst, dig deep, and get absolutely soaking wet. After all, sometimes you gotta rock the boat to land on unknown shores. 

Finally, our business' core values are defined by the acronym PURE:

Passionate
We are driven by passion. Passion for exploring different parts of this planet, and interacting with it in new and exciting ways. 

United

Swedese is a classic Swedish furniture producer with a strong anchor in both the public and domestic domain.
Swedese's ideals are the same today as they have been for the past sixty years. These are to create beautiful furniture for the future, which build on the foundations of Scandinavian modern traditions, designed by forward-looking designers who share in the timeless ideals of architecture.

Swedese was founded in 1945 by the two brothers Yngve and Jerker Ekstr√∂m and Sven Bertil Sj√∂qvist, with Yngve leading the company until his death. The present owner of Swedese is Mrs. Elisabeth Johansson. The headquarters are located to Vaggeryd in Sm√•land, Sweden, where one of the factories can be found. The second factory is located in √Ñng, a small village outside N√§ssj√∂, Sweden.

Many modernist architects were universal designers with not only a clear understanding of designing houses, but also the interior, the furniture and almost the clothes the owners might wear. Swedese's founder, Yngve Ekstr√∂m, was no exception. Together with names including Alvar Aalto, Bruno Mathsson, Arne Jacobsen and Poul Kjaerholm, Yngve Ekstr√∂m was at the core of a generation of designers who made the concept "Scandinavian Modern"‚Äã famous all over the world. With a keen eye, he designed Swedese's furniture, he designed together with L + M Architects also the head office building, logo, catalogues and personalised Christmas cards including their own poems. And so on.

The most well known design of Yngve Ekstr√∂m's extensive portfolio is the Lamino armchair from 1956, which is still manufactured and sold all over the world. In 1999 the Lamino was voted the Twentieth Century's Best Swedish Furniture Design by the Swedish interior design magazine Sk√∂na Hem.

Sudio lives our values in everything we do. What we do is sound. 

Every sound you‚Äôve ever heard was a collaboration between you, the airwaves, and the source. Sound - by its very essence - is meant to be shared, whether it‚Äôs a voice, a melody, a beat, or a signal. 

We share in a collaborative workforce who, in turn, share differing points of views from their diverse personal backgrounds. We share a common purpose: to share the creativity of artists, elevating their work with auditory excellence.

All sound is a challenge to silence; to the status quo.

We challenge ourselves to innovate, thereby challenging the boundaries within our industry and the expectations of consumers.

Every sound is initiated in an act of creativity. 

We initiate small ideas and scale fast, proving even the softest voice can cut through the noise. We initiate incremental improvements that lead to leaps and bounds over time.

Sound is evolutionary. 

We evolve because sound evolves; just as technology evolves; just as art evolves; just as human beings evolve. 

Our purpose is progress. Our process is sound.

The obesity and diabetes epidemics are worsening - more than two billion people are overweight and over 400 million have type 2 diabetes. 

We believe these diseases can be prevented and reversed by evidence-based lifestyle changes. This includes eating a low-carbohydrate diet, intermittent fasting and other factors. By making low carb simple, we aim to empower people everywhere to dramatically improve their health. 

Diet Doctor in brief:
- Founded in 2007 by CEO Dr. Andreas Eenfeldt, MD.
- Purpose: Empowering people everywhere to dramatically improve their health.
- Mission: Make low carb simple.
- Values: Goodness, Trustworthiness, Simplicity, and Inspiration.
- Fast-growing, close to 100% a year on key numbers, now 50+ employees and about 20 freelancers, moderators and partners.
- 10 million visits per month for DietDoctor.com, making it by far the largest low-carb or keto site in the world.
- The #1 ranked fitness or nutrition website in the world according to Trustpilot.
- Highly rated on Glassdoor.
- Site is available in English, Spanish and Swedish.
- No money from industry, no products for sale, no ads.
- Fully owned by our coworkers ‚Äì zero outside investments.
- Profitable, not just recently but also overall since the founding!
- Material thoroughly evidence-based by the 20+ medical doctors on our medical review board and expert panel, led by our Medical Director Dr. Bret Scher, MD.
- Fully funded by the people ‚Äì over 75,000 paying members (membership is optional).
- Everything people need is available for free.

At Didriksons we have one simple philosophy: We don‚Äôt challenge the elements. We adopt to them. That is the same idea used by Julius and Hanna Didrikson when they started making workwear for the fishermen in Grundsund, on the rim of Sweden‚Äôs western coastline, back in 1913. Functional garments that kept the wearer dry and happy whatever the weather. For more than one-hundred years we have stayed true to our concept, and probably that is why we still are the leading brand of rain- and weatherproof garments in Scandinavia.

Our garments are made for everyone, for you and me. For everyday people, aged 1 to 100 years old. Didriksons once started out as a family company, and we still act like one. We love the family. Our concept is to create functional clothes, with a timeless design, to be worn every day, no matter what the weather.

Today the world is different than it was when we started. That means we have to take better care of it. We constantly develop our environmental work, and strive to reduce our footprints in this world. We minimize chemicals, we ban all toxic substances, and we try to reduce our use of water, energy and transportation as much as we can. This is an ongoing work, and we‚Äôll probably never finish.

So if you decide for a Didriksons garment, remember that we put all our expertise, every single year of product development and knowledge, into every single item that we put our brand on. Because we want you to stay dry, happy ‚Äì and active.

‚ÄúWe transform mindless consumption into conscious decisions.‚Äù

We exist to create elegant, thoughtful and sustainable everyday products. We refuse to take shortcuts, and we obsess over every single step in the journey of our products, from how they are made to how they end up on your doorstep. We always walk the extra mile to improve our products and our processes, to ensure that we always are as responsible as we humanly can be. 

OUR COMMITMENTS.
Most companies use fancy phrases such as corporate social responsibility and talk a big game about their sustainable value chains. But dig deeper and it‚Äôs hard to understand exactly what phrases like these really mean. 

We make it simple for you. 

- Regardless of what it costs, we will always pick production materials that have the least environmental impact.
- We only work with suppliers that we know inside out, to ensure we share the same values and get an intimate understanding of their production techniques. 
- We never ever use harmful industrial chemicals in our production, such as acidic bleach or Bisphenol A plastics.
- We meticulously identify the potential environmental impact of all our operations and make sure to always compensate for emissions resulting from shipping & travel.  

COMPLETELY TRANSPARENT.
Stating that we strive towards sustainability isn‚Äôt enough. We believe being completely transparent with our customers will spur us to push even harder, and we encourage you to take part in and understand exactly how our products are made.

We detail the environmental footprint of each and every one of our products. We account for the materials used, total water consumption, the source of energy used in the production, and the carbon emission footprint of both production and shipping. We also benchmark our products against competing products in the same category. 

What‚Äôs more, we list all of our suppliers, detailing their ownership structure, their certificates and their work environment. 

/ Agood.com

Coloreel is a Swedish textile innovation brand with a groundbreaking technology for embroidery that enables high-quality coloring of textile thread on demand, unlocking a world of potential. We use our technology to both preserve the craftsmanship of embroidery and take embroidery to the next level. The unique solution makes previously complicated designs accessible, including gradients, textures and other stunning effects. Using only a single thread and needle means that it also significantly improves quality and efficiency, enabling immediate start up and faster delivery. In short, Coloreel empowers creativity and enhances quality and efficiency, making the ordinary extraordinary.

Coloreel is also part of the movement to reduce waste and move the textile industry towards more sustainable production. By coloring the thread directly, there is no wastewater, hence no water pollution. And, using a single reel of thread and needle also means minimized thread waste and minimized microfiber pollution. 

The result, of course, is embroidery at full potential.

NK Retail is the single largest merchant in Nordiska Kompaniet with a large number of stores within fashion, beauty, accessories, fine jewellery and fine watches. NK Retail offers a unique distribution platform for national and international brands within the luxury, affordable luxury and premium segments. 

NK Retail develops inspiring destinations with world class brands and services, and the company has an extensive operation at Nordiska Kompaniet (NK) in Stockholm and Gothenburg, with a wide variety of multibrand concepts. Vision

About Nordiska Kompaniet
Nordiska Kompaniet is one of Sweden‚Äôs strongest brands and one of Europe‚Äôs leading marketplaces. The department store in Stockholm is over 100 years old but the ambition remains the same: to be a world class commercial and cultural theater.
 
Hufvudstaden AB owns AB Nordiska Kompaniet, which in turn owns the NK real estate in Stockholm and Gothenburg, the brand NK, NK e-commerce and NK Retail AB. The stores at NK are operated by freestanding companies under department store like forms. All departments have separate leasing agreements with AB Nordiska Kompaniet. In total approx. 100 companies run 110 NK departments in Stockholm and 50 departments in Gothenburg. 

Nordiska Kompaniet bought Departments & Stores Europe AB, founded in 2005, in February of 2021. In the acquisition Departments & Stores became NK Retail AB.

Tshirt Store is dedicated to t-shirts.

Norrgavel was founded in Sweden in the early nineties. Since the start, sustainability has been the core of our business. From nature. With nature.

Nirvan Richter, founder and architect, wanted to design furniture he felt the market was lacking: high-quality furniture of natural materials that would last and could, if necessary, be repaired or reupholstered and passed on from generation to generation. Furniture whose design is timeless and offered an alternative to mass-produced furniture for rapid turnover. 

We decided early on to work solely with natural materials, for two very good reasons:

- Purely environmental. Our aim is to create products that are part of the natural cycle, which we do by using renewable raw materials.
- Lasting beauty. For Norrgavel, natural materials is also an aesthetic choice - they stimulate the senses, can be kept in good condition and generally age beautifully. It¬¥s about the sensation you get from running your hand over a soft soap-finished piece of oak, or feeling the different qualities of linen. 

In 1998, Norrgavel became the first comany to acquire the Nordic Swan Ecolabel for home furniture. The following year we received the Swedish furniture industry¬¥s environment prize, awarded in conjunction with WWF. Several pieces of Norrgavel furniture have since received design awards, with environmental credentials often cited by the jury.
