Transforming the future of protein supply. That's our goal.  
We have to change the way we produce food for the world's growing population, in order to sustainably feed the world and minimize the effect on climate.  Insects are very efficient in converting biomass to high quality proteins and oils. It's possible produce them in large scales in automated facilities, using side streams from the cereal industry.  That's making them both sustainable and very economically viable.  

We have specialized in processing the food for the future.  We have developed a new protein food ingredient derived from mealworms. It's  88% percent pure, neutral in taste, white in colour and have promising functional properties.     
If you what to know more about us and what we do, don't hesitate to contact us.

We dug deep and discovered a new, plant-based alternative for making drinks: the genius potato. DUG, our new potato-based drink is deliciously creamy, makes perfect foam in coffee, works just like any other milk, and just so happens to be the most sustainable alternative on the market. Genius, right?

DUG will be launching in early 2021, created by Veg of Lund, an innovative Swedish company, rooted in scientific food research at Lund University, Sweden. Our mission is to make it easy for you to make a no compromise, plant-based, tasty and sustainable choice, free from common allergens, that will benefit your health, society and the future of our planet. Above all, we are committed to maintaining a low ecological footprint, through efficient land use, low water consumption, and sustainable packaging. 

Our first product, My Foodie¬Æ, launched in 2018, was crowned "Best Convenience Food" at the World Food Innovation Awards in London, March 2018. It was also finalist in 3 other categories, including ‚ÄúBest Free From Product‚Äù, ‚ÄúBest Brand/New Business‚Äù, and ‚ÄúBest Technology Innovation‚Äù. 

Listed on the Swedish Stock Exchange since February 2020, Veg of Lund is now expanding into the UK, China, and the USA, with an innovative pipeline of plant-based, tasty and sustainable products, free from common allergens, that will benefit people‚Äôs health, society and the future of our planet.

We deliver a one stop shop private label 2.0 solution within beauty and accessories; from sourcing, product development and warehousing, to brand development and communications.

Our unique setup enable us to adapt to our partner‚Äôs specific needs, ranging from delivering one single unbranded product to developing a full scale beauty brand.

PRIVATE LABEL 2.0
Private label should not be ‚Äùcheap products with loveless design"‚Äã. We believe its ambition always should be to take on the market leading brands, a brand strong enough to stand on its own legs. This applies no matter the price point and category, if you solely rely on the packaging design as the brand builder or have the full on branding and communication ambition. We should compete with all aspects of the product and brand, not just the price which is a short term solution to win people over.

We believe that the  beauty and accessories industry very much is signified by ‚Äúwear and tear‚Äù and is in need of great change to become smarter and more sustainable. However, we can‚Äôt do this on our own over night, but through incremental steps we promise to, step-by-step, push all our stakeholders (resellers, producers & consumers, creatives, logistical partners) to take steps into a more sustainable behavior, including production methods, logistics, strategies, design, packaging, material and more.

ABOUT US 

For more than 100 years we have been establishing new standards time after time for what valves and actuators can do in different systems. All our products have three clear features in common: they use less energy, they enhance comfort and they improve safety; in systems for heating, cooling and tap water. 

Today, ESBE products are present throughout Europe. Yet our product development and manufacturing are still based in the small Swedish village of Reftele ‚àí where it all started. We have today access to the most modern factory facilities and are of course also in possession of quality and environmental certificates.

Never stand still and a continuous development are top issues at ESBE. The development we are thinking about involves the entire company but the most visible outcome is the constant flow of new products.

BUSINESS CONCEPT

We will help our customers provide property owners in Europe the market‚Äôs most resource-saving products and solutions for regulating heating and cooling in hydronic systems.

CORE COMPETENCE

Our core competence is in heating and cooling in hydronic systems for small-scale properties, mainly in valves and actuators.

BASICS

‚Ä¢ Established 1906 in Reftele, Sweden 
‚Ä¢ Quality certified according to ISO9001 since 1995 and enviromental certified according to ISO14001 since 1999.
‚Ä¢ 40 million Euro turnover 
‚Ä¢ 220 european employees 
‚Ä¢ With our 6 sales subsidiaries plus dedicated partners in more than 30 countries.

Emma Wiklund (maiden name Sj√∂berg) has a background as an international top model with a modelling career spanning over 20 year. She belonged to the era of the 90‚Äôs supermodels. Emma S. is based on her personal experiences and the type of skincare products that she herself has always used.

‚ÄúIn the 90‚Äôs Photoshop wasn‚Äôt an option, and therefore your skin had to look perfect. Working as a model, my skin quickly became one of my most important tools for work.‚Äù says Emma.

During periods Emma did experience some problems with her skin, and she got in contact with a French dermatologist that helped her to sort through the jungle of available skincare products. ‚ÄúWhen we started Emma S., we wanted to develop a pharmacy-like skincare series based on the type of skincare I have always used myself. Products that really work and give you visible results‚Äù, says Emma.

Our aim is to create well-being through good light.

In close collaboration with leading architects and designers, W√§stberg creates long-lasting, technologically driven, economically viable and environmentally conscious lighting. Lighting that answers to fundamental human needs, both
physical and emotional, and adapts to these needs as they evolve and shift.

In our 2008 manifesto Lamps for Neanderthal Man, we pointed out man‚Äôs primitive relationship to light in the form of fire. For more than a million years, fire was our only artificial light source. It frightened off wild animals, brought us together, kept us warm and made us feel safe. Above all, it was a light source that we could keep close, that we could control. 

Electric light has been around for little more than a century ‚Äì a blink of an eye in comparison with human evolution. Today, we find ourselves trying to tame our primitive needs to meet the demands of a modern, high-tech world, where light has more or less become a world of electronics. In our overly-lit spaces ‚Äì created under the mistaken notion that more light equals greater productivity ‚Äì we feel exposed, small, with nowhere to go.

We believe in creating modern-day fires. Light should shine for us, not on us. 

We also believe in lighting that answers to fundamental human needs. The need to be able to see, read and write, but also to reflect, envision and imagine. The need to be a part of a dynamic social context, but also to be able to withdraw to a personal sphere of familiarity and safety.

Technology and innovation are at the heart of what we do and are crucial to providing good light. However, we understand that what‚Äôs technically possible is not always humanly preferable. To us, true innovation means making the effort to find the best possible solutions, putting equal effort into both the measurable and the immeasurable

We make furniture for people.
Not for art or cost-efficiency, but for those who will use it.
We make our furniture for your home. For the hotel, you visit and the dining-rooms you eat in. For your meals, your meetings, your moments for yourself.
For us, every piece of furniture has its own purpose. We make each piece in a unique way. Yet always with the same idea.
It must be beautiful to look at, lovely to sit in and durable enough to use. Over and over again.
That‚Äôs why we started G√§rsn√§s, where the timber grew next to the factory. Ash, oak and beech. With passionate craftsmanship that respects every growth ring. And a devotion to passing knowledge on.

It has been 125 years now, and we still follow the same philosophy today. With the same materials, in the same factory, with the same skills created over generations.
But our most important work is not done in G√§rsn√§s.
It is done everywhere.
For us, every piece of furniture is a journey of discovery. An exploration through time and space. Through the history of craftsmanship and the future of design. To the place where our furniture meets you who will use it.
If we are to make furniture for people, then we must never stop wondering. Never stop asking and never stop being astonished. We have to always search, try, fail and improve until each angle is well thought-out and every detail has a purpose.
This is how we build furniture at G√§rsn√§s.
With classic craftsmanship.
Genuine materials.
And a never-ending curiosity.

Fashion is a funny thing. The word implies constant change ‚Äì always moving on to the next big thing, the next trend and the next look. That‚Äôs not Morris. We prefer the word curious ‚Äì and as a brand you could say that we‚Äôre style curious. That means that Morris prefers to rush slowly. The results are always better that way. We know who we are, where we‚Äôre coming from, and also where we‚Äôre going. Let‚Äôs take it from the beginning.

The name Morris comes from the legendary men‚Äôs shop, which was located on Hamngatan in central Stockholm from 1949 to the beginning of the 70s. Morris was the destination of choice for gentlemen of all ages. The store attracted dandies throughout the country with a passion for British-made clothing and accessories that were synonymous with quality.

‚ÄúI thought the historic connection was amusing, but Morris is also a good name. It‚Äôs as simple as that really,‚Äù says Jan Als√©n, the founder of Morris. 

Our style foundation and inspiration comes from the classically preppy, but mixed with an ample portion of contemporary and innovative influences, and a dose of obstinacy. Geographically, we firmly belong on this side of the Atlantic. We‚Äôve borrowed classic old-world charm and convention from the British with a bit of eccentricity thrown in. The streets of Paris, Milan and Rome taught us chic elegance, and a certain nonchalant ‚Äújoie de vivre.‚Äù And from Sweden and Scandinavia, our place of birth, we learned about design, quality and straightforwardness ‚Äì useful character traits when bringing Morris out into the world.

Fashion does change from season to season, even for Morris. But being style curious rather then trend driven, we‚Äôre selective in what we pick up and mix into each collection. Often it‚Äôs rediscovering classic pieces, and giving them an update in design, material and colour. All Morris collections are carefully curated ‚Äì every single garment or accessory has our love and approval, and hopefully our customers‚Äô too.

WELCOME TO THE WORLD OF LIGHT MY FIRE 
At the heart of our company we have one purpose; to create products that reconnect us with nature, wherever we are. We combine design and functionality with the joy of adventure and new experience. From lunch breaks in local parks, to meals whilst hiking in vast forests. From family grills in city gardens to cooking on the peaks of mountain ranges, our dream remains the same: To enjoy the beauty of the outdoors, to think of generations to come, to encourage the exploration of forgotten skills and to rediscover, the art of fire.

Come join us!

HISTORY

ACG Accent AB is part of ACG-Gruppen AB since 1961, run by the Westerlind family. The company started with machinery for the garment industrym working with suppliers such as Reece, Lewis and Eastmanm and is still distributor for Eastman and Reece.

ACG-Gruppen AB comprises a number of different companies with a variety of directions. Apart from ACG Nystr√∂m AB, the group includes ACG Accent AB, ACG Fyrtal AB, Eskils Tryckeri AB, ACG Elec Sweden AB, Kinna Automatik AB and others. The total turnover exceeds SEK 350 million with a staff of approximately 200 employees.

The label department was established 35 years ago as a department within ACG Nystr√∂m AB, Even then the focus was on textile branding, mainly for the Swedish garment industry. in 1991 ACG Accent AB was created as a subsidiary company within ACg Gruppen. Growing constantly since its inception, ACG Accent purchased all mechanical equipment from Stema Specialtryck during the spring of 2010. THe deal resulted in a solid expansion for ACG Accent, which currently has 50 employees and a turnover of approximately SEK 70 million. ACG Accent boasts its own design studio and production of both label and transfer concepts, and offers a global logistics solution. The ambition is to be market leader within these areas

European Leader in home delivery of quality products for your dog and cat.

Products

Husse dog and cat food is made of super premium and premium quality ingredients and is produced in the best factories with highly professional people and equipment. 

A guarantee for the quality of the products and the production process is the number of loyal and satisfied customers Husse has all over the world. Besides that, we have product sheets that give insight in:
composition,
analytical constituants,
additives,
metabolised energy,
digestibility and
general information about the product.
The Husse production process is closely monitored, tested and controlled. We produce quality food with care for nature and the specific needs of animals. Our veterinarians and nutrition experts team is always testing the composition of our food in order improve the quality. 

Research in our Pet Research Center is limited to animal friendly and not harmful food research. The only purpose is to improve the cat and dog food. Not harmful means, so that our animals never suffer because of medical or surgical procedures. The research is limited to the registration of food consumption, judgments from excrements etc. The animal experiments are strictly regulated by recent laws. Taking in consideration these laws, research as it is performed in our research center is not even considered as animal experimentation.

 
Services

Husse stands for 100% reliable delivery of products directly to our customers doors on a fixed schedule. We also guarantee that products can be delivered at any time of the day; seven days a week and that customers have complete access to advice in pet maintenance issues and nutrition.

As simplicity is another central Husse brand value, we are constantly working to further improve and simplify our logistics system. Orders can be placed around the clock by customers using our website, phone or fax.

Leca International is a Saint-Gobain company developing, producing and marketing Leca products. Our main product is the Leca¬Æ Lightweight Aggregate (Leca¬Æ LWA), which is a simple, flexible and long-lasting product. Alone, it is just an expanded clay pellet, but combining multiple into an aggregate, the possibilities become numerous. 

Traditions and history 
Leca has been around for a long time, starting up in Scandinavia in 1938. Because of our high life expectancy we know that our products work and that they are long-lasting with a minimum of maintenance. In Leca we continue to develop and innovate our products, always looking for new partnerships and business models, that can boost Leca, our partners and the environment. 

Organization 
Leca consists of more than 500 employees in 12 different European countries. Leca¬Æ LWA are produced in factories in Denmark, Sweden, Finland, Norway, Poland and Portugal. Furthermore, we have sales offices in the UK, Spain, Germany, Lithuania, Estonia and Latvia. 

Products and markets 
Our main product is the expanded clay pellet, used for various purposes, such as projects concerning infrastructure, housing and water management, where product properties like light weight, strength, durability, drainage capacity and thermal insulation are highly appreciated. In addition, the pellets are used for producing blocks and elements, which hold a high position in several of the national Leca markets, especially in Northern Europe. 

TOGETHER we BUILD for the FUTURE 
We have defined the brand essence of Leca as ‚ÄúTOGETHER we BUILD for the FUTURE‚Äù. 'Together'‚Äã because we include our partners and customers in the process. Many challenges are solved in close co-operation between us and designers or builders. 'Future'‚Äã because the building industry is constantly changing. It is important for us to keep up with the new development within building, technology, economy and environment. Those who do not think ahead, will not be part of the future.

Kang aims to produce the best alpine ski poles in the world. 

We want skiers to care about their poles. Our soul is Swedish but inspired by cultures who for centuries have lived in snow filled environments, such as Eskimos and Sherpas. They have a respectful and loving relationship to mountains and snow, as do we. The name Kang is Tibetan and means "snow" or "mountain peak"; exactly the things that we and our kins love.

Kang cares about the skier and that will always be our focus. Our products are developed to enhance the skiing experience. Our pole should always have that little extra that makes you care. Design you talk about, materials you care about and functions you dream about. 

At the same time Kang cares about snow and the Alpine environment we ski in. Because if we don't care there might not be any snow left for future generations. We strive to make the smallest environmental impact possible. We focus on limiting the amount of energy we use in production and we hope to someday have poles completely made out of natural materials. But we never do it on the expense of product quality simply because quality poles will last longer.

We are a company which produces shirts and knitwear, we specialise in these categories but we adapt to our customers, with our expertise in processing our garments such as; embroidery, changing buttons can shortening sleeves. 

Feel free to contact us, or if you swing by our office in Dalsj√∂fors, for a cup of coffee in our showroom.

Belts and accessories
At our production plant on the Swedish west-coast we manufacture belts and accessories of vegetable tanned full-grain leather. We are proud of our heritage: Made in Sweden!

Capacity
With a flexible organization and a modern mechanization, we are competitive in serving all types of customers ‚Äì on local or global markets. Maintaining speed to market with high quality is something we are especially proud of and is one of our key areas of focus. 

Knowledge & Experience
In addition to having 30 years of experience and knowledge in the leather industry, our strength lies in guiding our clients towards a more sustainable choice. We endeavor to change the market for leather belts and leather accessories and become the leader in our niche.

Our vision is to change the market for leather belts and leather accessories. 
In line with this vision we provide the global market with attractive leather products, produced in Sweden and with care for man and nature. We aim to take a leading position in the transformation of the industry for leather belts and leather accessories.

Advagym from Sony helps unlock the full potential of your gym. Scale your business, motivate and inspire your members, and create new revenue streams. Fujifilm Corporation

Fujifilm Corporation is a wholly owned subsidiary of Fujifilm Holdings Corporation, headquartered in Tokyo, Japan. The company was founded in 1934 and then produced photographic film under the name Fuji Photo Film. Since then, the business has expanded explosively both in terms of product areas and markets. Fujifilm have today offices all over the world with nearly 80,000 employees. The company operates in a wide range of areas including digital cameras and photo films, camera lenses, recording media, medical equipment such as mammography and x-rays, flat screen materials and office products, veterinary equipment, pharmaceuticals and cosmetics. The company strives throughout its operations to contribute to advances in culture, science, technology, industry, better health and protection of the environment.

We are CURA of Sweden, the Swedish company offering a full range of sleep-enhancing products. Our primary goods are weighted duvets and blankets, but we also offer pillows, bedding, sleep accessories, publications about sleep, and more - all for adults and kids. 

What are weighted sleep products? 
In healthcare, weighted blankets have long been used to help people sleep better and thus get more energy to cope with everyday life. We want to make it possible for everyone. Having a weighted duvet or blanket and getting a good sleep restores energy, reduces anxiety, improves well-being, increases comfort. 

You can trust us.
All CURA duvets and blankets are registered as medical aids at the Medical Products Agency: LVFS 2003:11, LVFS 2001:7, LVFS 2001:5. Our products are CE-marked according to the Medical Technology Directive, class I. We test the products in professional laboratories, to ensure that they meet our environmental requirements.

Baum und Pferdgarten was founded in 1999 by Rikke Baumgarten and Helle Hestehave from a dream to create fashion with an element of irony and a signature that is poised somewhere between harmony and quirkiness. Rikke Baumgarten and Helle Hestehave are well-known for their uncompromising approach to design, quality and their focus on details.

The creative manifest of Baum und Pferdgarten is to differ from the masses both in design and in process. The designer duo is known for not compromising on quality or esthetics √¢‚Ç¨‚Äú the high quality is reflected in both the fabrics as well as in the attention to detail and craftsmanship in the manufacturing. The collections from Baum und Pferdgarten give women an opportunity to express themselves individually by offering a combination of a classic styles and avant-garde pieces which can be mixed accordingly to the individual taste or occasion. Rikke Baumgarten and Helle Hestehave like to approach their designs with a touch of irony and humor √¢‚Ç¨‚Äú and hence their signature is somewhere in between harmony and quirky playfulness. Through the years Baum und Pferdgarten have received numerous awards and been exhibited in various cities as a sign of recognition for their innovative design.

Currently Baum und Pferdgarten is available in more than 25 countries worldwide and leading boutiques and department stores offer the collections to women in metropolitans as Copenhagen, London, Paris, New York, Hong Kong, and Tokyo.

GUBI is a global design house pursuing evolution with courage and intuition. Founded in 1967 by the parents of Jacob Gubi, who today runs the company and successfully transposed his creative vision into a contemporary context.
 
Born from a family spirit with a strong passion for design, GUBI has always followed its instincts for finding forgotten icons from the past, enter collaboration with contemporary designers and creating appealing designs that evoke emotions. Falck Healthcare works to improve health. We build on our Falck values and our objective of always being available and ready to provide assistance wherever needed.

We help keep people healthy and provide health and safety at work. Much of what we do is prevent illness and attrition, both physical and mental. An equally important part is helping people on sick leave return to work as quickly as possible.

Our mission is to create visible, efficient, measurable and lasting change for our clients and customers in the field of health, illness, absence and attrition. We always focus on the individual customer, and we do not compromise on quality.

Global Fashion Agenda is a non-profit organisation that fosters industry collaboration on sustainability in fashion to drive impact. With the vision of a net positive fashion industry, it accelerates action by mobilising, inspiring and educating all stakeholders.

The organisation has been leading the movement since 2009 and is behind the renowned international forum on sustainability in fashion, Global Fashion Summit, the Innovation Forum, thought leadership publications including Fashion CEO Agenda and Fashion on Climate and impact programmes including the Circular Fashion Partnership.

In partnership with its Strategic Partners, ASOS, BESTSELLER, Global Fashion Group, H&M Group, Kering, Nike, PVH Corp., Ralph Lauren Corporation and Target, and our Strategic Knowledge Partner, McKinsey & Company, Global Fashion Agenda spearheads the fashion industry‚Äôs journey towards a more sustainable future. Through its work, Global Fashion Agenda reaches thousands of stakeholders including brands, innovators, NGOs, policy makers, manufacturers, investors and more.

Wood Wood is a contemporary fashion and lifestyle brand founded in 2002 by Brian SS Jensen and Karl Oskar-Olsen in Copenhagen, Denmark. 

Best described as delivering contemporary, accessible streetwear, Wood Wood‚Äôs collections feature new takes on iconic silhouettes with a sports-fashion approach ‚Äî staying true to the subcultural heritage of the brand. Wood Wood mixes high fashion, sports and streetwear tropes with elements of youth culture, art and music. 

Aiming to find the perfect balance between style and functionality, Wood Wood's collections serve as tailored and sophisticated offerings, all the while retaining a playful graphic nature that often revolves around juxtapositions and iconography. With a unique approach to fashion and the outspoken claim "Not To Be Trusted", Wood Wood has the proven ability to continuously evolve and surprise.

A global mindset has allowed the label to establish multiple partnerships over the years,  with each project encompassing live and digital experiences. Wood Wood has worked with brands such as Nike, Barbour, adidas and Eastpak, as well as creatives including Peter Sutherland, Elmgreen & Dragset and Fuzi UVTPK, totalling over 50 collaborations.

‚ÄúWood Wood is much more than a brand. It‚Äôs about style and attitude. We were raised with the desire to evolve constantly, and we‚Äôll keep on taking the brand even further by combining elements of underground and high-end into our very own aesthetic‚Äù. ‚Äî Karl-Oskar Olsen, Co-founder.

An eye for the simple and a nose for the functional is the essence of Paustian's work, from its inception in 1964 to the house as we know it today. With a complete range of furniture, lighting and accessories, Paustian is one of the forerunners within Danish and international design with shops located in Copenhagen and Aarhus.

Our Business Division
We specialise in supplying interiors to state-sector and private companies in Denmark and all over the world. We provide public, private and multinational corporations with insight and inspiration, from the initial sketches until everything is in its place. 

Our own furniture collection
Our own furniture collection is designed by young and experienced Danish architects and designers. A growing percentage of those designs are produced in our own factories and sold under the name Paustian Furniture Collection. The goal is to create lasting value.

That little extra is a standard
Once you have your own furniture factory, it is easier to get desks, counters and cupboards to fit the facts. Paustian‚Äôs own team of professional joiners know the products better than anyone and completes the design on site. They are ready to undertake tasks of any size. Also out in the big world and inherently with sustainability and environmental thought down in detail.

Advice on space and time
To separate play from work is a bad idea if you ask our interior designers. For them, it is all about stimulating and activating. It is about freedom of movement, smooth transitions from home to work and furnishings that promote mental and physical performance.

Specialists in custom design
po inventar which is part of Paustian specializes in producing custom-designed furniture adapted to the architecture of the building, always in a good quality and with a high design content. It has led to some important interior design and supplies primarily for Danish companies and institutions, often in collaboration with architects.

We don‚Äôt expect you to go through this process alone. Actually, we guarantee that you won‚Äôt have to. Here, you‚Äôll quickly discover that we value the community higher than the ego. Our employees describe it as a ‚Äòwork hard, play hard‚Äô mentality, and they would know. It‚Äôs the passion that drives you to go that extra mile for a customer and the pro-activeness that leads you to fix a problem for a colleague before it arises. Liva Healthcare is Europe‚Äôs leading provider of scalable digital health coaching. Through an app Liva is providing personal human coaching programmes to help people manage obesity, pre-diabetes, type 2 diabetes and cardiovascular diseases.

Liva is headquartered in Copenhagen with offices in London and Berlin, and the company's multi-award winning platform is now operational in nine countries across Europe and the South-Pacific. 

The company was founded in 2015 by‚ÄØthe founders behind Europe‚Äôs leading independent health information portal,‚ÄØNetDoctor.com, Rune Bech and Carl Brandt, together with Kristoffer From.

In 2017, Liva was selected by NHS England among 84 providers as a digital provider to their world-leading National Diabetes Prevention Programme (NDPP).

Among Liva‚Äôs other major clients are insurance giants like AXA and Bupa, and pharmaceutical companies like Amgen and Novo Nordisk, and public and private healthcare providers across Europe. 

Through Liva‚Äôs app, users have access to a real human health coach, designing a personalised lifestyle change programme for them based on their individual needs. 

After a live video kick-off the participant then receives continuous professional guidance, support, motivation, and empathy via Liva's app. The goal is to help them prevent, manage or reverse chronic conditions through a new sustainable healthy lifestyle and behaviour changes. 

Participants can track their progress real-time via the app and engage with a support group of peers to keep them motivated. 

In several studies, Liva has been proven to drive substantial clinical outcomes, also in socio-economic backgrounds normally hard to reach.

Liva is funded by VerlInvest, MIG, Digital Health Ventures, Santo Venture Capital, and Maj Invest.

Johannes Carlsen begyndte savv√¶rksvirksomhed under trange og slidsomme k√•r, hvor Hans Hansen, den lokale skraldemand, med hest sl√¶bte tr√¶stammerne ud af skoven og med hestevogn transporterede tr√¶et hjem til forarbejdning p√• savv√¶rket i Fr√∏slev. Det var et opslidende arbejde, hvor han ene mand m√•tte l√¶sse de tunge tr√¶stammer.

Til opsk√¶ringen havde Johannes Carlsen i begyndelsen √©n enkelt fritst√•ende sav, der blev trukket af en gammel, larmende petroleumsmotor. Denne var overd√¶kket med et primitivt tag b√•ret af en nedgravet granp√¶l i hvert hj√∏rne, hvorved han fik ly for vejr og vind. Virksomheden blev under 2. verdenskrig brugt som tilholdssted for danske frihedsk√¶mpere. Savv√¶rket var i familien Carlsens eje frem til 1978, hvor Jens P. L. Petersen og Fuglsang Savv√¶rk k√∏bte det til eksportvirksomhed og lager med Jens P. L. Petersen som primus motor og daglig leder. I 1982 overtog Jens P. L. Petersen savv√¶rket, og i de f√∏lgende √•r blev der l√∏bende foretaget moderniseringer.

I perioden frem til 1985 blev der savet omkring 30.000 m3 pr. √•r. I november 1985 blev Fr√∏slev Savv√¶rk desv√¶rre flammernes bytte, hvor b√•de produktionsbygninger og maskiner nedbr√¶ndte til grunden. Savv√¶rket l√• stille indtil 1988, hvor Jens P. L. Petersen og hustru Christa L. Petersen atter pustede liv i det, nu under navnet Fr√∏slev Tr√¶. Virksomheden blev √¶ndret til en handels- og engrosvirksomhed med speciale i forarbejdet og/eller trykimpr√¶gneret fyrt√∏mmer.

S√∏nnen Martin L. Petersen indtr√•dte i januar 2011, som et led i et planlagt generationsskifte, i den daglige ledelse. I slutningen af 2012 overtog Martin L. Petersen virksomheden, efter endelig gennemf√∏relse af generationsskiftet.

Fr√∏slev Tr√¶ A/S besk√¶ftiger i dag knap 100 medarbejdere og regnes for at v√¶re blandt landets st√∏rste grossister indenfor tr√¶branchen.

At Lactosan A/S we take pride in our interest in Cheese Powder, in fact we cannot stop thinking about it. After all, we did invent it!

THE HISTORY OF FYNBO
Fynbo Foods began life in 2002 in brand new production facilities on Sigenvej in Vr√• ‚Äì a small town in the heart of Vendsyssel in the northernmost part of Denmark. It is an area of rich countryside and strong traditions for the production of jams and marmalades.

All our products continue to be produced at our facility in the attractive region of Vendsyssel.

MISSION AND VISION
With focus on sustainability and innovation, to produce, market and sell processed fruit and vegetable food products of uniform quality at competitive prices.

On the basis of the above, the company‚Äôs mission is to meet the needs of quality-conscious and price-conscious consumers for safe, fresh and great-tasting products, just as we also want to provide retailers with private label products.

Furthermore, the company has a vision to be the retail trade‚Äôs preferred business partner in Scandinavia and a supplier of Danish food specialities throughout the rest of the world.

"We are not metal benders ‚Äì we are in the entertainment business"‚Äã. That brief sentence sums up Weber. It all began with a horse-drawn carriage. In 1895, the young Niels Eilersen started out as a coach builder. To make his wheels, he was the first person in Denmark to use steam to bend wood. When cars eventually ran horse-drawn carriages off the road, Eilersen started making handmade bodies for cars and busses. In 1934, the factory burned to the ground, however, this marked the start of an entirely different production process. From then on, Eilersen focused on producing high-quality upholstered furniture. The sofas soon became very sought after, and they still are to this day. Today, the company is run by the fourth generation. Eilersen furniture, is the result of proud traditions and modern development. As such, the creation of every piece of furniture is based on genuine craftsmanship and fashion-conscious design. To many people an "eilersen"‚Äã is also a unique feeling of comfort... or as we say "enjoy an Eilersen!"‚Äã. Making quality since 1895.

SELECT is one of the world‚Äôs leading manufacturers of hand-sewn balls and produces approx. two million balls a year exporting to more than 50 countries.

In addition to balls, the company's range comprises literally everything within particularly football and handball, including sports bindings, sports care, goalkeeper gloves, training equipment and clothing.

The company was founded in 1947 by Eigil Nielsen, the Danish national football team‚Äôs goal keeper. In Eigil Nielsen‚Äôs days top players could not live solely from their sport so he chose to train as a sports psychologist and also had a job in the shoe and leather industry. Here he created the first SELECT football.

In 1962 SELECT introduced one of the greatest inventions in the history of football - the 32-section ball. At the beginning of the 1970's Eigil Nielsen was again a forerunner when he and SELECT brought out a handball with 32 sections.

All sorts of football and handball tournaments are still played with balls based on Eigil Nielsen‚Äôs 32-section principle - just as all the balls produced in the world today are built on his innovation.

SELECT is partner of a long list of federations and clubs in the world of football and handball and is furthermore deeply involved in a number of humanitarian projects around the globe.

GLOBAL FUTURE OF AQUACULTURE
Alpha Aqua A/S was founded in 2017 by two well-esteemed Danish companies, each with long track records in the aqua industry. They were determined to gather the best and most innovative technicians, vets and biologists in the international aquaculture industry in order to design and build the next generation of RAS systems for the global market.

A LAND-BASED RECIRCULATING AQUACULTURE SYSTEM FOR A SUSTAINABLE FUTURE
Alpha Aqua A/S provides a unique approach to the aquaculture industry: 
‚Ä¢	Turnkey solutions
‚Ä¢	Modular systems/production units developed in phases
‚Ä¢	Faster construction, no fixed concrete structures implying
‚Ä¢	better Return on Investment (ROI)
‚Ä¢	Efficient planning, safer production units, and lower total costs
Producing total solutions within on-shore fish farming, Alpha Aqua A/S has developed a system that ensures that fish farming can take place on land in a recirculating aquaculture system where the water is purified and not replaced to any great extent - this has the potential to disrupt the industry since we have the solution to the environmental challenges that fish farming can entail.

WE SUPPORT THE UN GLOBAL COMPACT 
At Alpha Aqua, our mission is to contribute to the development of more sustainable aquaculture production, thus making it possible to utilize the world‚Äôs aquacultural resources more effectively. As such we want to help facilitate a change towards consumption of more sustainably produced protein.

To enable us to continue supplying the growing world population with enough protein in the future, fish production will need to rise. In the future of aquaculture, the concept of circular agriculture is essential.
Alpha Aqua uses recyclable food grade PP (polypropylene) for their Water Treatment Units as well as the tanks and production systems. The concept has been developed and designed with a strong emphasis on sustainability, fish welfare, a minimum of environmental impact and strong construction principles.

In 1927, the textile company F. Engel was founded. Mr Carl J. Engel senior had just been on a visit to the USA where he noted the special denim clothing used by construction workers. He took inspiration from it and decided to introduce it in Denmark which is why he brought a pair of Bull Denim-overalls home from 'over there'‚Äã. This was the start of one of Denmark‚Äôs very first workwear manufacturers.

Subsequently, development speeded up. In 1964, F. Engel entered fashion business. At first, it was a series of men‚Äôs trousers called IN-CA, later the brand Easy Line and, in 1990, it was the purchase of the Sunwill brand.

The workwear production has also been developing rapidly with the purchase of the exclusive WorkZone workwear in 1996.

Mr Carl D. Engel‚Äôs very big leisure passion, hunting, resulted in 1985 in the founding of the exclusive hunting clothing Deerhunter.

Today, our group is divided in three strong and independent divisions: The workwear division, the men‚Äôs clothing division and the hunting & outdoor division. We are 120 employees in Denmark and we manufacture our products in our own dressmaker‚Äôs workrooms in Lithuania.

The textile group F. Engel is today run by the 4th generation of the family and the brand is stronger than ever. We can thank two things for this success. Our ability to constant development as well as a firm conviction to stand on our traditions on non-compromising high quality.

At +Halle we research, analyse and think carefully about how we put together, facilitate and create furniture that helps people get the most out of the environment they are in. The key to proceedings in our work is a shared vision of enjoyable and dynamic public landscapes with a clear sense of purpose.

We believe in challenging the composition of office environments and public spaces.

A day at work might have become less physical; yet, greater demands are made on for the surroundings to be evocative. Dwell time in public may have increased, and a range of diverse - both lively and quieter - areas are needed at all hours of the day.

We are knowledge driven, open and collaborative, this, to find new withstanding elements for both social time and private space. With advances in multidisciplinary research and collaborative design projects, we offer well-thought trough human settings, resulting in qualitative and functional improvements to any commercial or institutional space.

Our design philosophy is clear; resourcefulness matters to us. Which is why, we have a shared commitment to designing better public environments in every way. However, resources to us are not only about being rational. We improve the public realm by designing for humans, developing narrative tools, as opposed to static sedentary installations.

Our methods are immersive and include teams of researchers, experts and designers, who build scenarios, sets and urban fictions. Our furniture is made as configurations of public habits, continuously pushing the boundaries of what a piece of furniture‚Äîif seen as a consequential resource‚Äîcould possibly deliver.

For 45 years, uno form has embodied innovative and uncompromising Danish kitchen design. A uno form kitchen is your guarantee of the finest joinery created by passionate craftsmen of long-standing tradition.

uno form was originally developed by the ingenious visionary Arne Munch, who in 1968 designed the very first uno form kitchen. The kitchen offered a radical alternative to the inflexible, heavily crafted kitchens of the time, which allowed neither freedom nor originality in terms of kitchen layout. From the basement of his home in Lyngby, Arne Munch created an entirely new kitchen concept, whose simple ingenious design revolutionised kitchens.

Arne Munch was inspired by the attractive and original cabinet furniture of the time and insisted on incorporating this same elegance and high quality into his kitchen design. With this in mind, he created the uno form kitchen with its characteristic slotted fronts, which have made uno form a genuine Danish design classic and one which has retained its originality for 45 years. With the refined slotted design, Arne Munch also introduced the handle-free kitchen, a revolution that highlighted both functionality and aesthetics.

KOMPROMISL√òS √òKOLOGISK KVALITET
I dag virker det uforst√•eligt, men da Thise Mejeri bliver grundlagt i 1988, er der ingen der t√∏r satse p√• √∏kologi. Hverken politikere, butikker eller mejeriselskaberne.

Eventyrsport startede i et lille butik i et 46 m2 stort k√¶lderlokale i midten af √Örhus. Navnet p√• butikken var p√• dette tidspunkt ikke Eventyrsport men Toursport, og vi havde kun √•bnet fra kl. 13 til 17. Men stille og roligt blev √•bningstiden udvidet, og inden l√¶nge k√∏rte butikken p√• fuld tid. Derfor tog vi i 1998 et stort skridt, ud af k√¶lderen og ind i en ny og mere professionel butik.

Snart var vi atter p√• udkig efter mere plads. Men intet virkelig passende dukkede op - indtil en dag ... En smuk butik i det gamle shopping omr√•de, kendt som latinerkvarteret, i midten af √Örhus var blevet ledigt. Denne forretning var det bedste, vi havde set hidtil, men desv√¶rre var lokalet ikke meget st√∏rre end den nuv√¶rende Toursport. Og derfor besluttede vi os for at √•bne en ny butik med mere fokus p√• bekl√¶dning og fodt√∏j end tidligere. Navnet p√• den nye butik blev: "Eventyrsport"‚Äã. 

Navnet er sammensat af ‚ÄôEventyr‚Äô og ‚Äôsport‚Äô. Ordet 'sport'‚Äã understreger et element af at v√¶re aktive samtidig med at man nyder sine egne personlige eventyr - rejser, vandreture, skil√∏b, og har det sjovt. Vi fandt det var et passende navn til en ny outdoor-butik i Danmark. 

I dag har vi 10 butikker - og forh√•bentlig er vores eventyr f√∏rst lige begyndt. Det tror vi det er, for vores engagement fra begyndelsen - kvalitet og service, kvalitetsprodukter og gode priser - har virket indtil videre, s√• det har vi ikke t√¶nkt os at lave om.

Our only real company asset is the people in our organization, the knowledge they possess, and their ability to apply it effectively every day.

companyName: Danitacom - ‚ÄùItalian Chamber of Commerce in Denmark‚Äù
description:
The Italian Chamber of Commerce in Denmark has its headquarter in Copenhagen. 

The Chamber was founded in 2010  with the mission to increase trade between Italy and Denmark, and to support the development of business activities for those Italian companies that are interested to move into the Danish market. Since its establishment, the Chamber has developed many structured projects always with the purpose to boost trade between the two markets and to promote the Made in Italy-brand in Scandinavia. The Association has offered different services to numerous Italian companies that were interested to approach for the first time the Scandinavian market or to consolidate their position in Northern Europe. At the same time, the Chamber has supported Danish companies interested into the Italian market, thanks to translation activities, legal and commercial assistance.

In November 2013 the Chamber has been granted the full membership to the Association Assocamerestero, which represents the major network for the Italian Chamber of Commerce in the whole world, and in 2015 it was fully recognized by the Italian Ministry for Economic Development. Since its constitution, over 500 Italian companies and 700 Scandinavian companies took part in the Chamber's activities in order to support and to establish new trade flows between Italy and Denmark. 90% of these companies are small or medium enterprises, and most of them are family-owned.

Airofit is a Danish developed training system, tailored to athletes who expect more from their performance. 

The original device was created for asthma and COPD patients. Since then, the breathing trainer has been developed to improve the breathing of athletes and be a tool to assist the athlete in his or her ambition for greatness. 

So, how does it work? 
The Airofit device is connected to an app that measures your results and improvements after each breathing session. In the app, there are multiple programs which all focus on different areas of your breathing. Each session results in a different benefit that takes you to a higher level of performance.  

Having different training programs gives you the freedom to improve and focus on the areas, that are the most important for you. The goal is to train your respiratory system overall, as having a thorough knowledge of how this works and obtaining a powerful breathing helps your overall performance.

Svendsen Sport are making the fishing experience better. Back in 2013, Basic Apparel was founded. This was the start of an exciting travel - and it still is. The idea was to create clothes, that people would use again and again. We wished to create that piece of clothes, that you continually grab from your closet, because that particular piece makes you feel most comfortable. It was and still is, clothes like that, we are creating for our customers and ourselves. 

Furthermore we wanted to give the brand a clean Scandinavian expression - good basic clothing with few details, made with good qualities and reasonable prices.

We want to work against the flood of fast fashion, and create slow fashion instead. Fashion that lives more than one season, simply because it's everybody's favorite clothing. 
Our philosophy was and still is - there is no need to make it harder than it is, which makes our brand simple and basic. 

We design every style ourselves and only get our clothes produced at places we feel safe traveling to. We visit our manufacturers many times a year, to ensure that the working environment and our clothes meets our standards.
We are proud to be represented in the following markets so far: Denmark, Norway, Sweden, Iceland, Greenland, Netherlands, Belgium, Germany, Switzerland, Austria, France, England and Israel. 

We hope you like our philosophy and our styles as much as we do. 
Stay tuned and follow us and our journey.

Lots of love,

The history of New Nordic dates back to the beginning of the 90's in Copenhagen, Denmark. Two friends, Marinus Blaabjerg and Karl Kristian Jensen, shared a passion for healthy living and decided to quit their job, and create a company using a new technique to extract a natural-source antacid found in the fruit fibers of citrus fruits. The product relieved heartburn and acid reflux without disturbing natural acid levels in the stomach. Since the launch of Frutin, for over 20 years New Nordic has been producing effective natural supplements in Denmark, Sweden and Norway that sell all over the world. We have built our own operation in more than 20 countries from Canada in the west to China in the East.

We have continued actively along this path, seeing the development of numerous vitamins, minerals, herbal and other food supplements that help to promote vitality, well-being and fight age-related degeneration.

We believe in long-term commitments and are dedicated to establishing New Nordic as a significant supplier to the health and beauty market. We are a company that takes the social and environmental implications of its activities seriously and respect the well being of all of our employees, customers, and business partners. We believe uncompromising quality in every product we deliver and we are concerned about the quality from field and forest to the package in the shop.

HYDRACT CONTROLLED by WATER... ENGINEERED by HEART

The name HYDRACT is an abbreviation of the two words HYDRaulic ACTuator.

HYDRACT was founded on the fact that water is incompressible and, therefore a more reliable media for process valves, in terms of energy consumption, total cost of ownership, and functionality. 

The development of the HYDRACT water hydraulic technology was based on the recognition of 4 basic needs in the brewing industry, which have subsequently also proved to be valid in other industries.

Reducing CO2 emissions, improving profit and reducing capital investments, Increasing requirements for food safety, and the need for speed to market.   

Our goal is to make the beverage producers more profitable, sustainable and to make it simpler for the industry to produce.  

We make sure that our customers can deliver each and every product they manufacture with pride and confidence.

We have helped one of the industry‚Äôs largest and the group's most complicated breweries by turning their processes upside down and given them a whole new way to pursue energy efficiency and operational excellence.  

We develop water hydraulic solutions for the world's beverage producers, simplifying the processes and tackle the climate challenges by reducing the need for electricity and water.

We make the beverage industry more profitable and sustainable.

Did you know that you can create a positive social and environmental impact in the world by changing to the right coffee supplier?

Slow helps larger companies take tangible action on their sustainability strategies by offering a cutting-edge regenerative coffee solution. No greenwashing here; we simply mean business.

With total transparency and no carbon offsetting programs, we are working directly on the ground with local farmers to produce good-tasting and forest-grown coffee with 91% lower carbon emissions than conventional coffee. We even offer regenerative and nature-positive coffee solutions for our larger clients!

Slow has removed up to 15 intermediaries in the coffee value chain to have full ownership. The released value is then reinvested in nature and communities to grow coffee in forests and preserve and regenerate more forests. 

Our team in Laos works directly with our community of micro farmers to preserve forests and grow great coffee. Additionally, we are converting many hectares of monoculture coffee plantations into diverse coffee agroforestry, giving life back to nature. 

We have taken ‚Äúfair trading‚Äù to the next level by offering farmers a 40% pre-payment to balance their cash flow. We have established an emergency health foundation for the farmers. We educate them in sustainable agriculture practices, helped them get bank accounts and even make individual livelihood improvement programs.   

All this and much more we do because we want to be the best coffee company in the World - for the World.

Nupo - "To make life a positive experience for people while they're on a diet"‚Äã

In 1981, the leading Danish obesity researcher Dr. Flemming Quaade
developed a solution that would change the lives of his overweight and
obese patients. A formula to help them lose weight while providing all the
nutrition the body needs.

At the time, dieting generally meant abstaining from certain foods or from
eating altogether. We knew that unhealthy and unbalanced diets negatively
impacted people‚Äôs health and psychology, resulting in failed weight loss
attempts and fatigue.

In pursuit of our ambition to set a new standard for weight loss products,
we innovated the Nupo Very Low Calorie Diet (VLCD). The VLCD diet
liberated dieting making it healthier for the body with products containing
all the essential vitamins, minerals, proteins and fibers. Once the diet
products were in place, we needed a compass to guide different lifestyles
and diet preferences. The Nupo Brick System was born out of this need.
It removed strictness from dieting, making it flexible to the needs of every
individual. Nupo Brick System liberated the mind from dieting, making it OK
to eat the things that made you happy, as long as you stayed within the
boundaries of your daily brick count. At the time, such adaptability was
unheard of.

Our goal has always been to help people maintain as normal a
lifestyle as possible and still lose weight.

That‚Äôs why Nupo is considered the world‚Äôs most comfortable diet.

ANOUR is a Copenhagen based lamp manufacturer, specializing in bespoke handcrafted LED lamps. 

Anour is lamps for a unique clientele. We combine traditional Danish materials and methods with new technology and trends to create a lasting, yet unique product.

Arash‚Äôs Persian roots and Danish upbringing influence his company‚Äôs products and policies. The company name ‚Äì nour ‚Äì means ‚Äòlight‚Äô in Farsi, and the design of his lamps reflect traditional Danish values of simplicity and sustainability.

Arash claims that the secret to Scandinavian success in the design world can be summed up in two words: ‚Äúno nonsense‚Äù. Rather than incorporating excessive design features into products, the Danes focus on crafting the essentials with quality. 

To Arash, the word ‚Äòsimple‚Äô does not mean settling for the ordinary. Arash strives to create or exceed trends, not just follow them. He reveals, ‚ÄúI combine rare materials made by one of the last braziers in Copenhagen with new materials on the market.‚Äù This mix of old and new differentiates Anour from competitors in the lighting industry.

Arash defines sustainability as the creation of something that lasts. He says, ‚ÄúI hope to create a product that people cherish enough to restore.‚Äù He also hopes his product will become a classic design icon for future Scandinavian designers.

Sustainability also incorporates quality. Arash ensures that each lamp is handcrafted to perfection through his employment of a traditional Danish brazier who has worked with brass, copper and bronze materials for decades. This expert brazier implements the natural colouring processes of browning, oxidising and polishing to ensure the lamps‚Äô quality do not deteriorate over time.

‚ÄúHaving a company is like having a child. You must nurture it and maintain its health so it develops into the best example of you.‚Äù
- Arash Nourinejad

Worktops are not just a surface. With 50 years of experience, our dedication to producing the finest is seen in every detail
The best material and our great craftsmanship, ensures you with a 30 year warranty. It certainly has already been shown that the quality and design are some of our hallmarks. When you decide to invest in a product from SPEKVA you can be sure that every little detail has been carefully selected, inspected and manufactured by hand.
We place great emphasis on craftsmanship and for decades have used a special method to join wood staves. Instead of gluing the staves flat side together, which is the most common, we join the staves by tongue and groove which are pressed together then glued. This allows up to 40% more surface area for the glue to bond, which prevents cracks from appearing later in time. 
 
This method together with the best raw material provides an incredibly strong construction and a very long warranty of 30-years.

Leca Danmark A/S is a Saint-Gobain company developing, producing and marketing Leca¬Æ products in Denmark. Leca¬Æ Lightweight Aggregate (Leca¬Æ LWA) is a simple, flexible and long-lasting product. Alone, it is just a single expanded, lightweight clay pellet, but combining multiple into an aggregate, the possibilities become numerous.

Traditions and history
The company we know as Leca Danmark A/S was founded in 1938, where it produced its very first lightweight aggregate. The following year, the first rotary kiln was built and this has delivered lightweight aggregates to our customers ever since. 

Organization
Leca consists of more than 500 employees in 12 European countries. Leca¬Æ LWA are produced in Denmark, Sweden, Finland, Norway, Poland and Portugal. Furthermore we have sales offices in the UK, Spain, Germany, Lithuania, Estonia and Latvia. 

Products
Our main product is the expanded clay pellets, used for various purposes, such as infrastructure, housing and water management, where product properties like light weight, strength, durability, drainage capacity and thermal insulation are highly appreciated. In addition, the pellets are used for producing blocks and elements, which hold a high position in several of the national Leca markets, especially in Northern Europe.

TOGETHER we BUILD for the FUTURE
We have defined the brand essence of Leca as ‚ÄúTOGETHER we BUILD for the FUTURE‚Äù. 
'Together'‚Äã because we include our partners/ customers/ allied in the process. Many challenges are solved in close co-operation between us and designers or builders. 'Future'‚Äã because the building industry is constantly changing. It is important for us to keep up with the new development within building, technology, economy and environment. Those who do not think ahead, will not be part of the future.

companyName: Den Engelske Pub YNWA and its subsidiaries
description: The English Pub - "You'll Never Walk Alone"‚Äã was started up in the heart of Kolding in December 1990 as an attempt to create an authentic ENGLISH pub with an authentic atmosphere as opposed to so many others in this country who seemed to think that by hanging a Union Jack in the window they had found an alternative to traditional Danish beer taverns. Our bag-in-box bottling plant is applying one of the leading BIB technologies from Scholle that through a "Form-Fill-Seal" proces creates a hygienic and efficient in-line production of the bags directly from the film. The 6 head rotary filling technology encures the longest life through the gentle flow of the filling process and the industri's smallest content of air in the BIB-filled bags.

The bottling plant is integrated with fully automated and robot-driven packet and palletising. The entire facility is designed for highest level of full automation and thus minimal use of manual labour.

Globus Wine is certified according to IFS (International Food Standard). Accordingly, premises, plant and procedures are complying with the strictest standards in the market and setting the future standards for the industry. Furthermore, Globus Wine is among the few ECO-certified for bottling of organic wines. Globus Wine has its own in-house laboratory where all wines are analyzed in a number of parameters using a highly professional FOSS Wine scanner.

Selek's history - 45 years as a supplier of consumer electronics and accessories.
1973 Selek was founded in Sweden
1983 Invirgo was founded in Sweden
1990 LIFT was founded in Norway
1993 Bandridge Denmark was founded in Denmark (AV-LINE)

1996 Selek Norway was founded after LIFT Norway acquired Selek Sweden

2007 Supply Forum became a subsidiary of Selek Denmark

2015 China office established

Altiflex designs, manufactures and provides modules for sealing buildings. The modules  
- are adjustable in size 
- are wind and waterproof 
- gives huge energy-saving 
- protect against theft
- make the use of security railings superfluous.  

Altiflex modules effectively seal doors, windows, walls and facades during construction. The system consists of flexible window and door modules, which are made of aluminum and semi-transparent breakproof plastic. Each element can be adjusted by 25 cm in both height and width and can be put together in all imaginable sizes to seal any size of hole. 

Altiflex system is completely unique in the world and is patented in a large number of countries. It is a more sustainable, secure and gives particularly more efficient engines and more economical sealing than traditional closing with plastic sheet mounted on the batten frames.

The Altiflex system is reusable and can be reused from project to project.

Aduro develops, produces and markets wood burning stoves, hybrid stoves and pellet stoves in modern Danish design. For many years, we have been specialising in developing high-technology stoves with the most modern and advanced combustion principles. We do not compromise with product quality, and we always seek to combine technology and aesthetics with end-consumers‚Äô demand for user-friendliness and attractive prices. More than 400,000 Aduro stoves are installed across Europe.

Aduro and the environment
All our stoves are designed by Danish architects whose principal aim has been to create modern and environmentally friendly stoves. We strive to make it easy to do it right and thereby obtain a clean combustion with minimal CO2- and particle emissions. Among other things, all Aduro stoves have automatic control of air supply, so you can obtain a clean combustion more easily. When firing correctly with wood, an Aduro stove is a CO2 neutral heating source ‚Äì on average, each stove saves the environment from the emission of 4 tonnes of CO2.

Firing with firewood provides you with renewable energy, as the trees store CO2 while growing. When the trees decompose or are burned, they release the same amount of CO2 again. Meanwhile, Aduro ensures the growth of trees and forests through restoring of forests and sustainable forestry. Aduro invests in large areas of forest, in which we expect an annual sustainable growth of wood corresponding to the consumption in approx. 10,000 Aduro stoves. 

In June 2018, Aduro was awarded with the prestigious European Business Award for the Environment on a national level. The award was given for the innovative and sustainable product Aduro Hybrid in the category ‚ÄúSustainable products and services‚Äù. The European Business Awards for the Environment pays tribute to the most environmentally conscious companies in Europe, thus aiming to promote innovative and sustainable initiatives.

Do not hesitate to contact Vernon if you have something on your sport or fashion heart. In the creative Vernon environment in Copenhagen, we always have room for new ideas & new brands.

Founded in 2007, the Coffee Collective is to this day 100% owned and run by Peter N. Dupont, Casper Engel Rasmussen og Klaus Thomsen. With several competition awards in the bag, including gold in both the World Barista Championship and World Cup Tasting championships, we continue to explore exciting coffee experiences.

We roast coffee daily and ship directly to wholesale customers, our own coffee shops, subscribers and web shop customers. And yet, freshly roasted coffee is just a small part of the equation.

We source coffee directly from the farmer for two main reasons. To guarantee we get the best green beans, and to make sure the farmer is rewarded for the high quality coffee. It is actually quite simple. For the farmer to continue to produce specialty coffee, he or she should be paid extra for the hard work.

In our opinion, sustainability in coffee starts with financial sustainability for the farmers. To make a difference, we believe that we have to start with ourselves by making coffee experiences that contributes to this development.

At Motatos, we challenge the thought of sustainable consumption. We want everyone to be able to contribute to saving our planet in an effortless way, and we believe revolutionizing how we all look upon food waste is a good place to start. 
We are taking care of already produced surplus goods and selling it online at affordable prices to customers who want to buy perfectly good food that otherwise would have gone to waste. 

Join our revolution!

***Background***
The problem with food waste is huge, and a third of all food produced in the world is thrown away.

Motatos was founded by a team of three passionate entrepreneurs in 2013, who had come up with a simple solution to this problem.

Today, we are one of the fastest growing companies in the Nordics, present in three markets and with 400 MSEK in run rate revenue. Backed by well-known investors we have very ambitious and exciting growth plans ahead. Our superstar team consists of 30-something bright minds in the Stockholm HQ office, 100+ super stars in the warehouse in Katrineholm, and now establishing a local dream team in Copenhagen. Join us and become a part of the food waste revolution!

FASHION TRENDS CHANGES, BUT OUR DEDICATION TO CONSTANTLY PERFECTING OUR TAILOR-MADE SUITS NEVER WILL. 

Sj√∂lin is, according to online rankings, the best notified firm within the category of tailor-made suits in the Nordics. We are confident that our unapologetic dedication to constantly perfecting our tailor-made suits and customer experience is the single most important factor driving our rankings upwards. 

Sj√∂lin was established in 2013 with an ambition to challenge the current way of acquiring a suit. But why? During his career as an accountant the founder, Patrick Pedersen, experienced that well-tailored high-quality suits are very costly and the reason is not simply huge production cost but in fact, the intermediaries between the producer and retailer that all charge a fee from pushing the products closer to the buyer. In many corporations, especially within the Audit, Legal and Consulting industry, employees experience that wearing a suit on an everyday basis is most often not only encouraged but strictly enforced by formal Dress-Code policies. Up until now, acquiring a sufficient amount of work suits has been expensive. 

Luckily, Sj√∂lin has managed to cut out all intermediaries thus making the traditional retail model much leaner and securing a great consumer price reduction. For that reason, we can at all times offer you our high-quality tailor-made suits made based on 27 individual measurement and in a quality corresponding to well-known brands at very low prices.

We produce to amaze. 

Do you need inspiration for your next suit? For more information, visit www.suitsyou.dk, like us on facebook at facebook.com/suitsyoudenmark, follow us on Instagram and Twitter at twitter.com/suitsyoudenmark and instagram.com/suitsyoudenmark.

Veras is a sustainable and circular recycling and exchange clothing concept founded in 2015 by Rebecca Vera Stahnke. Veras has created its own circular ecosystem that combines fashion and sustainability to stop clothing waste.

Veras mission is to contribute to a greener world by minimizing the amount of clothing waste. Veras wants to change the Danes consumer behavior by using existing resources and recycled their clothing items through Veras and therefore minimizing the amount of newly purchased clothes and the amount of discarded clothing.

Through Veras circular clothes and exchange concept in the stores and our reusable clothing markets, Veras Market, women can exchange their clothes to new items and renew their closets in a sustainable way. 

At Veras you earn points by delivering your unwanted clothes. Users switches clothes to points from a fixed system - and can then can buy new, used items for the points..

Veras assesses the clothes based on its lifetime. Veras is the only clothing concept in Denmark that guarantees value for all clothes - regardless of condition, style and brand. The less used and the better quality the more points it worth.

Users pay a fee of 5 DKK pr. item to exchange clothes to points - as a member for 99 DKK/month you skip the fee and get 10% on all purchases. It always possible to buy all with DKK.

Veras ecosystem guarantees that all clothing submitted has value. Clothing that does not match Veras style in the stores and online lives on in Veras stand at Veras Market, where everything is sold from 20-100 DKK. Clothing that cannot find new owners is donated to charity and recycling stations that recycles the textile fibers.

Veras physical stores are located in Studiestr√¶de 27, Copenhagen and in Pogestr√¶de 22, Odense. Every month Veras Market are held in Copenhagen and Odense. In addition, Veras online universe, consisting of a digital magazine and a webshop to inspire users to a sustainable and fashionable lifestyle.

The driving force remains a great amount of respect for the people who perform the physically demanding and risky work ‚Äì and a desire to ensure clothing that protects and strengthens its wearer in their daily challenges. Respect is also about a good and close dialogue with both end users and resellers, allowing us to constantly be pro-active with regards to new wants and needs ‚Äì from product development to service, trade, delivery and product documentation.

I sidste halvdel af 1700 tallet blomstrede b√•de handelen og velstanden p√• Christianshavn. Dette skyldtes ikke kun, at det Asiatiske Kompagni havde til huse her, men derimod ogs√• at de mange skibe der bragte varer fra det fjerne √òsten, lagde til ved kajen. Kompagniet var dog ikke det eneste, der solgte de hjembragte varer p√• sine aktioner. Mange andre k√∏bm√¶nd etablerede sig i n√¶rheden, og de fik varer fra Kompagniet samt fra de kaptajner der havde dispositionsretten over en del af skibenes last. Blandt de mest ansete af disse k√∏bm√¶nd var Jens Bay Perch, som st√∏ttet af sin gode ven Niels Brock, startede sin virksomhed p√• Christianshavn.

Hans s√∏n blev opkaldt efter vennen og kom til at hedde Niels Brock Perch, grundl√¶ggeren af det gamle Thehus. Niels Brock Perch¬¥s f√∏rste butik havde til huse under B√∏rsen, hvor Danmarks f√∏rste "supermarked"‚Äã s√• dagens lys. Det var nemlig her, at man for f√∏rste gang indrettede sm√• butikker side om side under samme tag.

I April 1835 √•bnede Niels Brock Perch s√• sin lille butik i Kronprinsensgade 5 , hvor theforretningen stadig har til huse, i samme interi√∏r, der i l√∏bet af de sidste 5 √•r har underg√•et en gennemgribende restaurering. Forretningen er udover det elektriske lys og "nyere"‚Äã personale fuldst√¶ndig intakt. Sl√¶gten Perch f√∏rer Thehuset videre helt frem til 1894, hvor familien Hincheldey overtager. Det er i dag 4. generation af sl√¶gten Hincheldey, der har den daglige ledelse. A.C. Perchs Thehandel er Kongelig HofIeverand√∏r og har de sidste 100 √•r v√¶ret et familiefirma, hvor der ofte har v√¶ret tre genrationer bag disken.

Den personlige kontakt og en seri√∏s faglig betjening har altid v√¶ret forretningens h√∏jeste m√•l.  A.C. Perch's Thehandel kan i dag gl√¶de sig over at have betjent syv generationer i √•rene 1835 til 2014.

Them Andelsmejeri producerer nogle af Danmarks bedste oste. Andelsmejeriet bygger p√• et st√¶rkt f√¶llesskab med solid lokal forankring og en historie, der g√•r helt tilbage til 1888. Crown Seafood offers a unique range of high quality seafood products to the European market. Our overall goal is to raise the standard of seafood in Europe ‚Äì both in terms of quality, consumer choice and true sustainability.

THE AUTHENTIC TASTE OF SEAFOOD
We want to bring the best of the ocean to Europe‚Äôs seafood lovers ‚Äì presenting them with high-quality products, which are carefully processed to preserve the authentic flavour, texture and appearance. 

As part of this, we aim to raise the overall standard, while complying with EU regulations and international standards set by the food and catering industry. 

EXPANDING THE WORLD OF SEAFOOD
We want to widen the selection of seafood available to the European consumer. Therefore, we venture the world to seek out niche products that are new to the market and explore new innovative ways of handling seafood.

As a result, we hold the exclusive distribution rights to the Madagascar Prawn in Scandinavia.

CERTIFIED SUSTAINABLE SEAFOOD
We have achieved MSC, ASC and IFS Certification, which guarantee our customers a high quality product that meet international standards of sustainability, social responsibility and food safety.

Crown Seafood was established in 2013 in Esbjerg, Denmark. Today, we supply food and retail companies across Europe (including Austria, Denmark, France, Germany, Italy, Sweden, Switzerland and the United Kingdom).

In addition to our own branded products, we also offer private label production.

The Viking god Njord has given name to our gins handcrafted from botanicals, grain, grape, potatoes, patience and curiosity in a small copper still in the middle of Jutland, Denmark. 

It all boils down to a deep and complex flavour. Every drop has a high quality. Each batch has its own personality. Season, soil and soul decide. Enjoy the mystery. Enjoy with care. It's your nature. Distilled. 

Behind every excellent and original idea stands a curious mind. In the case of the gin developed and distilled by Njord, it is actually two curious minds belonging to the friends, Lars Toke and Troels. A keen fondness of gin turned from hobby to a full-time passion in 2014. Ever since, they have been dedicated to crafting distinct avantgarde gin of the highest quality at Denmark‚Äôs only distillery devoted to gin.

The gins created by Njord are a reflection of nature. That is the mission behind each and every bottle. Njord goes beyond the simplistic flavour profiles traditionally consisting of juniper berries, coriander seeds and few other botanicals. Instead they create unique complex gins rooted in Danish nature. Njord is aiming to distill the most interesting gins possible by focusing on using complex distillates and hand-picked botanicals. That is why their gins are appreciated at the best restaurants and cocktail bars, loved by 
people who desire new taste experiences and why Njord is internationally renowned and awarded.

For three generations, Bosweel has been a family business with roots in the successful Danish textile industry. 

The company and brand was founded in 1937 and has designed, produced and manufactured shirts in nearly 80 years. 

Bosweel is the last remaining independent Danish shirtmaker. We are both proud and grateful to have survived the many changes in the clothing and fashion industry. 

First of all, we are shirtmakers, and we will never be anything else.

Secondly, we believe strongly in independence. Being able to think and act independently is fundamental to us, and enables us to maintain a corporate culture with focus on creating customer value. 

Thirdly, at Bosweel we will continue to follow our strong quality and design principles. We will never become blind followers of trends or the business models of other brands.

At Bosweel our creativity is inspired by strong and independent men and women who are able to stay true to themselves in our rapidly changing and turbulent world. We exist to learn from, appreciate, and dress strongly indent independent men and women.

A large portion of our turnover comes from B2B sales and private label sales. 

To serve this important business we have a dedicated B2B division where we offer a wide range of choises, and can help tailor specific solutions for both large and small businesses.

Depending on requirements and the desired quality, we can produce shirts at all price levels. 

All our production facilities are in Europe, which enables fast and flexible delivery.

We offer countless variations and options, and in consultation with our customers we always find a solution that meets their requirements.

The company Axel M√•nsson A/S is one of the most innovative producers of
organic vegetables and organic eggs in Scandinavia. Focusing on the soil, the plants and animal welfare, Axel M√•nsson has been producing vegetables and eggs for more than 40 years. Axel M√•nsson has an eye for tomorrow‚Äôs needs, and the company is constantly evolving. The range is expanding in line with product demand.

New products will typically arise from the local development and demonstration areas on the farm, where many new species and varieties are tested and produced each year.
Samples and smaller lots are shipped to customers for testing, and it is ensured whether it‚Äôs possible to produce the relevant product organically, on Brande‚Äôs light soil. New emerging organic products include: Fresh herbs and edible flowers, new types of cabbages and new specialty lettuces, as well as more exotic species.

Convenience products, such as whole peeled onions, have been part of the range for many years, and this segment is still being developed ‚Äì first and foremost as peeled onions diced or cut into rings. All products come in a variety of packages and in both organic and conventional variants.

The farm is wellknown for being open to the public. Guided tours, lectures and workshops etc. are available upon request. A former hen house is converted into a well-stocked organic farm shop, and an organic farm caf√© is on its way. 

Sustainable production
Axel M√•nsson has a vision to become self-sufficient of nutrients in order to fulfill the organic cycle. An organic biogas plant converts different biomasses to natural gas, for heating appr. 12,000 households. The degassed biomass is used as valuable fertilizer for the vegetables. The latest technology is used in e.g. weed control and packaging. Sustainability is in focus in all aspects of the production. Monitoring and analysis is continously used in the production to ensure efficient utilization of the resources supplied, as well as full 
traceability.
