Kiwi Group A/S was established in 1991 with the aim to install and operate candy machines in retail stores, businesses and public educational institutions. 

In 2004 the current management took over the company and has since developed it to include three business areas:

KIWI VENDING
Operates around 10,000 small vending machines (candy, toys and entertainment) in Denmark, Norway, Sweden, Finland and Germany. Purchases are made at coin-operated vending machines. The machines are serviced by partners, franchisees and our own staff.

KIWI TRADING
Kiwi Trading was established in 2007 and is a trading company that mainly sells FMCG products, including chocolate, confectionery, soft drinks, coffee, etc. in the global market.

KIWI RETAIL
Kiwi Retail was established in 2012 and today operates as a total supplier of confectionery, soft drinks and other impulse related FMCG products for non-food chains in Scandinavia. With the development of the concept SweetSpot‚Ñ¢, Kiwi Retail seeks to optimize, manage and renew chains impulse sales, so that the retailers can focus on their core business.

Focus is to develop "odd segments"‚Äã and identify "hard-to-reach"‚Äã markets and customers. Our core business is aimed towards top branded products & FMCG, such as chocolate and confectionery; soft drinks; beers; liquors; toiletries and consumer electronics. We mainly deal directly with brand holders, and new trade lines are constantly being sought and expanded.

At Halodi we are passionate about robots. Our mission is to bring capable humanoid robots to everyone. To achieve this,we have developed Eve, a full sized humanoid robot that will serve industry and consumers at an affordable price. ¬†

Eve is unlike any other robot, due to our Revo1 drive system with in-house developed motors and close to frictionless transmissions. This enables her to be the world‚Äôs first human strength direct drive robot, she operates silently and can safely interact with people. We have already set the world records for highest torque to weight ratio servo motors, most transparent transmissions and highest payload to weight ratio for a robotic arm, and we have barely started.

After developing our prototype robot, and successfully securing funding, we are preparing to scale up our organization to further develop our robot and handle production. 

Eve has been developed from the ground up to be mass produced at low cost and to handle the latency inherent in cloud computing. This will enable her to utilize modern artificial intelligence approaches for both reasoning and dynamics, and be affordable for domestic use given sufficient volumes.

Eve is a general purpose full size humanoid robot, capable of a wide variety of tasks. She will start mainly in the industrial and healthcare segments, where our high payload fully equipped wheeled platform with vision, arms, hands, hips and ankles will enable a lot of uses that are not cost effective today. As her intelligence develops she will gradually move towards the domestic consumer market.

In 1929, J√∏rgen J√∏rgensen, a Norwegian outdoor enthusiast, began his search for durable outdoor equipment to perform in Norway‚Äôs harsh and rugged land. Starting with simple innovations such as leather straps, canvas backpacks and cotton clothing, he set Norr√∏na‚Äôs direction: to search for the best in technical advancements, to create the ultimate in performance product.

Today, four generations later, as traditional mountain life broadens, we are still a Norwegian family-owned and run company. We inherit from our forefathers our commitment to advance the boundaries of product function, with design-bred solutions to equip you with the highest-grade, protective, sustainable gear for your outdoor needs.

We control the ultimate detail with the promise to bring you excellence through experimental, technical perfection assisted by our dedicated testers and ambassadors. From concept to creation, our in-house team of designers and craftsmen are compelled to stretch the edges of innovation. We build touchstone products, establish construction techniques, and redefine the meaning of fit, fabric, function and finish, based on our design principle of Loaded Minimalism‚Ñ¢.

Ethical trade and sustainability are essential in all parts of our value chain, and we believe that the only way to run a company is on a sustainable platform. We are completely transparent about our processes through our roadmap, ensuring we keep pushing ourselves towards reducing our environmental footprint and creating a positive impact.¬†

The Dale brands have been synonymous with superior textile quality for well more than a century. Over the past 40 years, since inventing FR work wear fabrics for the North Sea oil industry, Daletec has become a worldwide leader in flame retardant and protective work wear fabrics.

Our pioneering research has led to on-going innovation for the unique Daletec products now used in energy, electrical, metal and other heavy industries in more than 100 countries.

We have pioneered unique processes and specialized FR treatments for more than four decades, including impregnations, laminations, special coatings and other innovative FR technologies.

Our fabrics are famous for their consistent high quality, comfort and extreme durability, and Daletec is respected for delivering reliable service and environmentally friendly solutions. 

We‚Äôve provided enough FR fabric -- to heavy industry work wear manufacturers in more than 35 countries, on all continents ‚Äì to circle the planet several times over. 

Daletec fabrics provide the best flame protection in industrial work wear ‚Äì certified to all relevant EN ISO and NFPA/ASTM  standards  -- with flame retardant strength guaranteed for the garment‚Äôs entire lifespan. 

Other fabrics use technology that loses protection during wear and washing. Through Daletec‚Äôs unique processes the FR chemicals penetrates and bonds the textile fibre to ensure your protection lasts and lasts.

The first ‚Äúrevolution‚Äù in the grocery trade took place around 1960, which lead to a lot of mergers. 

Erik Haugen did not support this change, and when his son Gunnar L. Haugen took over as chairman, the idea of specialising in imports of branded products took root. 

Today our head office is in tailor made premises in Vestby 40 km (E6) south of Oslo. We are one of Norway‚Äôs leading providers of international well known brands within foods and beverages, being no. 1 or 2 in almost every category we operate.

Made for Movement enables individuals with severe mobility impairments to stand and walk independently. By combining our expert knowledge, developed from years of experience in listening to parents, school staff and professional therapists, we provide assistive technology that improves quality of life.

We work with individuals, families, other caregivers, therapists and physicians to design help-aids that are clinically effective and offer practical, everyday benefits.

Our innovative movement aid solutions are made possible by our investment in technical development and research excellence. Our product development team is based in Skien, Norway and combines expertise within electrical and mechanical engineering, 3D drawing and product design. The development department, working closely together with our other teams and, most importantly, getting feedback from your user experiences, is committed to user-focused, cutting-edge technical solutions.

Our highly-skilled assistive technology consultants are your main point of contact with us. They coach you individually, sharing their extensive knowledge of our assistive devices to advise and motivate users, caregivers and therapists. They ensure our customised help-aids are adjusted correctly, following up with each individual to help optimise user outcomes.

Training, education and support from Made for Movement‚Äôs teams is a vital part of our solutions. We have fully integrated these elements into our service to give you the reassurance that your needs can be met.

Inspired by Roald Amundsen's set of skills, J√∏rgen Amundsen, an industrial designer, questioned the way people today dress for their outdoor activities. It seemed the market had forgotten essential knowledge built up over centuries. J√∏rgen wanted to do something about this, and approached his childhood friend Erik Friis with his ideas. J√∏rgen and Erik had been competing in the same ski club in Oslo and done some travelling together in Patagonia. Erik welcomed the challenge and together they founded Amundsen Sports out of Oslo Norway in 2009.

The very foundations of Amundsen Sports, are made of the standards set by Roald Amundsen and his spirit of adventure. His successful combination of tradition with innovation strongly inspire us on our mission to enhance and simplify the everyday life for outdoor enthusiasts. Plany AS was established in 1964 as a sailmaker, primarily supplying ships and the shipping industry. Today, most of our customers come from the marine and maritime sectors. Our biggest markets are in aquaculture, shipping and shipbuilding.

Today, Plany AS has the equipment and the premises needed to handle large deliveries of technical textiles. We also have our own repair and service department.

R&D

De-ice tarpaulins that cover the whole cargo deck on supply vessels, canvas doors for ROV and MOB hangars, full-enclosure tarpaulins for enclosing salmon cages before delousing and freshwater basins for the salmon farming industry are examples of products that have proved successful.

THE ENVIRONMENT
Plany makes continuous endeavours to reduce its environmental impact and increase environmental efficiency in all parts of the value chain through preventive measures and by reducing resource use, emissions and waste. By keeping up to date with new and more environmentally friendly solutions, we are always able to offer our customers more environmentally friendly alternatives.

Lumarine AS was founded in 2015 under the name Rognkallen AS, and was initially a producer of lumpfish. The company was established by a group of people with years of experience in farming new species, and the company started operations in T√∏mmerv√•g in Aure municipality.

In 2016, Kistefos AS joined as owners, and significant investments were made in new infrastructure at the facility in T√∏mmerv√•g. This is now a highly modern and top quality facility. It has had full production of lumpfish since 2017.

In the first half of 2019, Lumarine acquired two companies: Njord Salmon AS in Tjeldbergodden and Atlantic Lumpus AS at Sleneset in Nordland. These companies are now named Lumarine Tjeldbergodden and Lumarine Sleneset.

Since acquiring Njord Salmon in 2019, Lumarine has been working on plans to exploit existing capacity and to develop activities at Bioparken. Residual heat from Equinor makes makes Bioparken a very energy efficient location for warm water aquaculture.

By signing partnership agreements with Mowi for ballan wrasse and Gadus for cod, Lumarine has successfully developed predictable production, based on existing capacity that will last throughout 2024.

The two contracts provide solid foundations for further development of this location. The cod industry is witnessing significant growth, despite being in an early stage of development. Young fish capacity is a bottleneck for cod farmers in their current efforts to scale up from trial activities to commercial volumes. Lumarine aims to take a leading role for the industry by providing young fish capacity at Tjeldbergodden, to meet the industry's needs. More specifically, this implies establishing new growth capacity in facilities to be filled with cod fry from the company's own production in collaboration with other fry suppliers.

ScanBio is Norway‚Äôs leading logistics- and processing company of by-products from the aquaculture industry. Every day, we play a key role in the management of marine resources in Norway, like we have for 30 years. To ensure industry-leading capacity and emergency response services for our customers, we continue to make large investments in the silage solutions of tomorrow.

ScanBio is the safest partner, whether you need regular collection of K2 silage, delivery of acid, or need help handling challenging emergencies across several facilities and regions.

Ensuring that no resources are wasted require competent employees at all levels of the organization, cooperation, and world class logistics. Together, we reduce our environmental footprint and invest in an innovative and green aquaculture industry.

The fish waste we collect is recycled and transformed into new sustainable materials ‚Äì raw materials used for production of bio energy and ingredients in new products. Every year, ScanBio contributes to environmentally friendly industrial products and 46 GW of bio energy, the equivalent of 1800 households.

‚Ä¢	Regular delivery of acid

In 2012, we were involved in a project with the Municipality of Bergen. The aim of the project was to motivate seniors and people with dementia to become more physically active. The results from the project were so good that we wanted to start up a company that would be able to offer the concept in all the Nordic countries. 
Motitech AS was consequently established in October 2013.

Today we help institutions and day-centres in Europe and North-America to provide increased exercise opportunities for seniors wiht help of Motiview.

Motiview is a motivational tool that stimulates older people and people with dementia to increase their physical activity. Thanks to moving pictures and sound, the user can take a cycle trip through familiar surroundings and childhood memories. 
The system is easy in use. It consists of a display unit that shows motivating videos, combined with a user-adapted exercise bike. 

We are passionate about seniors and people with dementia having increased quality of life and better physical health.

The story of Seagems Norway starts with the realization that global demand for seafood and proteins is on the rise, and our oceans‚Äô resources are under immense pressure. This creates new opportunities for the industrial operations. Seagems Norway‚Äôs mission is to upcycle existing residual raw material from the seafood industry, providing the global food industry with innovative, high-quality and tasty ingredients for food applicational purposes. Simultaneously, creating new revenue streams for the many seafood producers.

With more than 30 years of experience from the seafood ingredient industry Seagems Norway sees the urgency in demand for a new model to current operations that will benefit the producers, end-users and the environment altogether. Through the valorization of residual raw material at the location of processing, through the use of innovative technologies, Seagems Norway is able to retain the freshness of the raw material and valuable nutritional compounds, as well as reducing the carbon footprint of transportation, as the semi-finished product is in a highly concentrated form. This model builds on well-established and long-lasting relationships with the suppliers of raw material, where Seagems Norway heavily contributes with know-how and experience. Seagems Norway develops ingredients in close collaboration with its customers in order to meet their specific needs and applicational use. Today, Seagems Norway‚Äôs ingredients are a vital part of more than 2 billion meals served around the world. Since 2018 Seagems Norway has been building an organization with a key focus on lean and innovative scaling, with a fundamental focus on sustainability, bringing seafood ingredients to the global market.

Faun Pharma operates modern and efficient production of tablets, capsules, powder mixtures, liquid products and creams. With us all manufactured products according to stringent quality standards and international production standards. Our research department consists of highly educated employees with extensive research experience, whose main task is to drive product development for our customers.

The story of Lett

In October 2014, Knut Andreas Berg and Sebastian Wahl opened the very first Lett restaurant in Klingenberggata 7 in Oslo. With a background in finance and real estate, respectively, the two food enthusiasts wanted to make it easier for people to choose healthy and nutritious food.

Easy fresh salads and wraps fell in good taste with hungry Oslo residents. It did not take long before there where several departments in the capital, and the green message eventually spread all the way to Sweden: Our first restaurant in Stockholm opened in November 2017.

Working in line with the environment has always been an important part of Letts DNA. In collaboration with Klimato, we calculate the climate footprint of the dishes to ensure that everyone is below the UN target of 0.5 kg CO2-e. We get good, short-distance veggies delivered directly to the door by local farmers. All disposable packaging with us is made of plants, and the long-term goal is reuse. In 2019, we also established an internal climate committee, which analyzes operations and ensures that we make smart, green choices on the way to becoming a climate-positive player.

In 2019, Lett served over 400,000 tasty meals from our 10 departments in Oslo and Stockholm. And we are growing. With a dedicated group of cheerful people with ambitions and determination, 20 new restaurants will be established in the coming years. The goal is the same today as in the beginning: It should be easy to make green, good choices for both health and the environment. It should be easy to eat right.

BORA COOKTOP EXTRACTOR
A revolution in the kitchen

BORA cooktop extractor draws steam directly down from the cooktop and is:

- The most efficient extractor lets you cook without odor
- The quietest kitchen fan on the market
- Extremely energy-saving
- Easier to clean ‚Äì put all the parts into the dishwasher
- Exclusive and award winning design
- Made in solid and stainless materials
- Designed for the trendy and modern kitchen - flexible space usage and location of the cooking range
- Free view and open conversation in a dynamic and social kitchen

BORA nips cooking vapors and odors in the bud by drawing them off where they arise: directly at the cooktop, from the saucepan, roaster, frying pan or grill. And we do this not by magic, but by applying the basic principles of fluid mechanics. We simply use a cross flow which is greater than the rising speed of the cooking vapor.

As a result, steam, vapors and heat disappear immediately, so that you and your pots are surrounded by fresh and clean air. No more food smelling hair, clothes or kitchens.

Aurora Spirit is the northernmost distillery in the world at 69.39¬∞N. Set deep within the Arctic circle the distillery and its visitors centre is located at the foot of the majestic Lyngen Alps. The ground the distillery is built on not only offers beautiful surroundings, but also history, as it previously used to be a NATO coastal fort, built during the Cold War.

Made to be a Whisky distillery, Aurora Spirit makes use of the fort infrastructure, and stores the casks in old NATO bunkers. 

Under the brand name Bivrost, Aurora Spirit produces world-class gin, vodka, and the regional spirit aquavit. With a strong focus on quality, the distillery makes use of locally harvested Arctic botanicals, and naturally filtered glacial melt water.

The distillery is open to visitors, and offer guided tours and tastings.

V√•r filosofi:

Kort fortalt, √∏kologisk frukt og gr√∏nnsaker har h√∏yere n√¶ringsniv√• med blant annet mer antioksidanter. Du f√•r mindre rester av tungmetaller, og du unng√•r rester av kjemiske spr√∏ytemidler. If√∏lge et stort studie I Newcastle i England har de √∏kologiske produktene opptil 69 % h√∏yere innhold av viktige antioksidanter enn det som er konvensjonelt dyrket.

Om det er akkurat 69 % som er riktig kan nok de l√¶rde strides om, men vi vet at vi generelt sett kan si at √∏kologisk dyrkede produkter inneholder mer antioksidanter fordi de vokser saktere og derfor m√• kjempe mer for √• overleve.

De inneholder ogs√• generelt f√¶rre giftstoffer, og er derfor ogs√• snillere mot milj√∏et. Tungmetaller ble ogs√• m√•lt i studiet i Newcastle og her fant de at f.eks. innholdet av kadmium, som kan f√∏re til en rekke alvorlige sykdommer som kreft, nesten var 50 prosent lavere i √∏kologiske gr√∏nnsaker. Det betyr at √• velge mat produsert p√• en √∏kologisk m√•te kan f√∏re til √∏kt inntak av ern√¶ringsmessig gunstige antioksidanter og lavere eksponering for giftige tungmetaller.

Det er vanskelig √• si at et √∏kologisk kosthold helt sikkert har en helsemessig fordel, men det virker logisk n√•r vi vet at flere av antioksidantene i frukt og gr√∏nt har v√¶rt koblet til lavere risiko for kreft og andre sykdommer. Det er ikke slik at √∏kologisk frukt og gr√∏nt automatisk inneholder mer vitaminer og mineraler enn ikke-√∏kologiske produkter. Dette avhenger blant annet av jordsmonn, solforhold osv. der det dyrkes.

Derfor er Kolonihagen opptatt av √• velge de aller beste produsentene, som produserer langt over minstekravet i √∏kologi. Aller helst velger vi biodynamisk der hvor det er mulig.

At Moorup Europe we believe that there is a significant value potential in prolonging the use of consumer electronics.

The best of both worlds
Both Eskimos and people in Mediterranean countries have much lower rates of heart disease and many types of cancer than in Norway and the rest of Europe. By blending refined seal oil with olive oil, OliVita has combined the best of the Eskimo diet with the best of the Mediterranean diet. About Elvebredden Catering
The word Elvebredden translated to english means literally Riverside. When the company was founded in 2003, our kitchen and preparation facilities were located on the bank of the river Akerselven, and for this reason the first company vehicle was in fact a small boat for making deliveries to islands, other boats and locations along the Oslo harbor.

Today, 18 years later, Elvebredden Catering is one of Oslo¬¥s largest catering suppliers and employs between 50-90 people, depending on the season. Since the very beginning our team of drivers, cooks, servers, and office workes have been an international group of people from just about every corner of the world.

The menu includes Norwegian party-food staples, but we are best known for tapas and a contemporary continental selection of dishes for fine dining and informal events. 

In 2017 we had a total turnover of approx. 53 million NOK.

Etical and environmental standards
We are very serious about conducting business in a respectable and honest manner. This includes sourcing Fair Trade and ecological goods where possible. In addition we are committed to not making unnecessary impact on the environment. We have in place a number of routines and guidelines to help reduce waste and schedule smarter deliveries thus by reducing fuel and emissions.

Anteroz is the story of friends who found a flavour and a secret known by few but worth sharing with the whole world: mamajuana, a botanical sugarcane-based spirit aged on a 500-year old Dominican tradition hailed as a source of vitality, the cure to whatever tortures and an aphrodisiac. The stories behind mamajuana and the joy and passion with which the Dominicans serve and enjoy this exotic drink personifies the way they take life itself: as if it is not lived to its fullest, unless you do what turns you on.

To share this message with the world, we set out to create a global brand and spread this message in a bottle.

Since the founding year 1895, Berentsens Brygghus has always used fresh and natural raw materials and fruit extracts of the finest quality. Consequently all of our products are distinguished by a refreshing and genuine flavor that is always pleasing to the palate.

Through continuous testing I have achieved a comprehensive insight as to what is required to be able to produce refreshing and tasty drinks‚Äù, Harald Berentsen says, displaying a pride and respect of the previous 3 generations of connoisseurs. His thorough knowledge, insight and belief in that natural taste and flavor will never be out of fashion, have been the driving forces in the development of Berentsens alcoholic ciders, beers and other products.

today minimum consists of a dedicated team of more than 70 employees with a steady drive, informal tone and a great appreciation of the daily work that they‚Äôre carrying out. the headquarter of minimum is located in an old shipyard that has been repurposed into an authentic and open office environment at the industrial habour of aarhus.

minimum is a well-established brand and available in several retailers and showrooms across europe and canada and we always have a global outlook with a wish to expand to new and interesting markets.

minimum creates several annual collections and we pride ourselves in selectively picking out just the right designs and fits for each collection. the philosophy is to create eclectic, scandinavian fashion products of sublime quality ‚Äì always at the right price. We produce both the versatile classics for the basic wardrobe and the unique, eye catching styles that are perfect for those special occasions.


social responsibility at minimum a/s

at minimum we believe that the success of our business cannot be at the expense of humans, animals or the environment. moreover, it‚Äôs important to us that our employees are part of a healthy working environment which is why their well-being is our top priority. we are determined to take proactive actions that secure a responsible way of doing business in all aspects and we actively communicate these principles to our business partners and associates.

Pas Normal Studios is a Copenhagen based brand of contemporary, technical cycling clothing.

The concept of Pas Normal Studios is to create technically perfect apparel, combined with visionary aesthetics.

Through innovative designs, brand collaborations and sourcing of new production methods, Pas Normal Studios strives to bring out collections that define modern cycling in a different context.

The brand honors the great traditions of cycling, but is above all committed to the patterns and colors that define state of the art fashion today.

The uncompromised attention to detail and hand-made, sustainable quality is paired with an inspired take on today‚Äôs look and feel.

Pas Normal Studios produces high-end clothing with textiles and methods at the same level as demanded by professional riders ‚Äì but at the same time, all styles created for long-term usage and durability.

Based in Scandinavia, but with a specific international element, Pas Normal Studios can now be found throughout Europe, parts of Asia and the United States.

Bruuns Bazaar was launched in 1994 and quickly became a frontrunner of Scandinavian fashion, pioneering an identifiably Scandinavian yet international design aesthetic and look. 

Bruuns Bazaar was the first brand to present this look; one that generated a great deal of attention, interest, and admiration around the world. In January 1999, the brand entered the official show calendar in Paris, as the first ever Danish fashion brand. Today, Bruuns Bazaar is a contemporary brand on the rise, creating mens - and womenswear as well as accessories. 

Bruuns Bazaar ºs signature style is all about relaxed elegance. The look is vibrant and charismatic, and the individual expression is understated yet distinct. The blend of classic styles and modern pieces has created a group of loyal devotees, both throughout Europe and in other parts of the world. The keywords are cool comfort and Scandinavian simplicity. 

A team of entrepreneurs with extensive experience from all areas of the fashion industry, is now leading the brand towards a new vision and launch.

Since the beginning ‚Äúrock and roll"‚Äã lifestyle have been an influential source of inspiration at Won Hundred, which over time have shaped the heart of our identity. This is embodied in the continuous use of denim and leather, where we always try to move the boundaries of our Scandinavian and minimalist approach. That being said, our collections range from daring pieces with raw attitude, as well as versatile quality staples which will fit into everyone‚Äôs wardrobe. It is founder and creative directors Nikolaj Nielsen‚Äôs vision to create a brand that never loses its relevance, whether the occasion is work or leisure. 

Today we offer men‚Äôs and women‚Äôs ready-to-wear collections, including shoes and accessories.

Urbanista was born in 2010 in Stockholm, Sweden out of love for cities and urban life. Our products are rooted in Scandinavian tradition and inspired by music, arts, fashion and urban culture. We believe that lifestyle audio products should not only sound great, but also look good. Today, our products are available in over 90 countries, and sold in 30,000 stores worldwide.

Icelandic Water Holdings controls the sole commercial rights to bottle and sell water from the legendary √ñlfus Spring. The capacity of the Spring is recognized as one of the largest in the world. Its daily overflow is more than double the total quantity of bottled water consumed worldwide, delivering a naturally replenishing supply of exceptionally pure water which is bottled for discerning consumers to enjoy. 

Icelandic Water Holdings was established in April 2004 by a group of private investors and with an experienced management team, they have developed a world-class, NSF-certified bottling plant and a multi award-winning product under the Icelandic Glacial brand.

In the United States, it is distributed by Anheuser-Busch, which took a 20% ownership stake in the company in July 2007. Kalevala Jewelry has for the past 80 years been the most beloved jewelry brand in Finland. The classic and timeless designs have for decades been part of Finnish culture, celebrating the beauty and the power found in each of us.

Kalevala Koru Oy is one the largest jewelry manufacturers in northern Europe. The company designs, manufactures and markets high-quality gold, silver and bronze jewelry, and owns two high-level consumer brands: Kalevala Jewelry and Lapponia Jewelry.

We are a small dedicated team with a mission to end the need for single use items. Sensative is a tech company offering IoT services and products for a wide range of applications. Founded in 2013 in Lund, Sweden, Sensative has become a leading supplier of innovative solutions in the physical worlds' digitization. With a horizontal open IoT integration platform and non-intrusive, no-maintenance sensors, we provide users, services, and digital twins with live data and enable control for every need. 

IoT is not about collecting data to store for possible future benefits. It is about insights from live data and acting on that data in real-time. IoT means generating new data in a new way.

Developed for total freedom of operations through interoperability and open standards, Yggio is the IoT platform for any company that prioritizes flexibility and autonomy from siloed end-to-end solutions. By becoming independent from any specific developer when using an open API IoT platform, the customer will be free to choose the technology and supplier that best suits their needs.

To complement our IoT platform, or any platform that allows Z-Wave or LoRaWAN technology to be employed, we offer a wide range of IoT multi-sensors. With some differences in configurations, our multi-sensors offer humidity, capacitance, light, and presence monitoring, and the widely popular magnetic open/close sensor. As our IoT sensors are ultra-slim (3mm) and designed to be as widely employed as possible, they can be used in a multitude of challenging spaces or easily be hidden for aesthetic reasons. Besides the flexible design, our sensors also offer a battery life of up to 10 years. Our LoRaWAN sensors that can easily be employed indoors as well as outdoors also offer a range of up to 10km.

At Neutral¬Æ, we want our clothing to matter. We want it to be okay for everyone. Our planet. Farmers. Workers. Us. And you. That's why every Neutral¬Æ product is manufactured and certified according to the highest environmental, social, and ethical standards in the world.

WHAT 
Neutral¬Æ is premium quality apparel for men, women and kids. Contemporary styled T-shirts, sweatshirts and more made from 100% organic Fairtrade cotton. Based in Copenhagen, Denmark, with all manufacturing taking place in India, Neutral¬Æ is a market leading producer of sustainable apparel to the B2B-market.

WHY 
Neutral¬Æ is the result of more than 20 years of experience in the conventional textile industry witnessing a constant pressure for lower prices at the expense of natural and human resources. The defining aspects of Neutral¬Æ have been a holistic approach driven by commitment and above all a focus on action and continuous improvement. Today, Neutral¬Æ has developed into a platform for responsible clothing production and sustainable storytelling. 

HOW 
All Neutral¬Æ products are manufactured and certified according to the highest environmental, social, and ethical standards in the world. Alone, none of these certificates meet the Neutral¬Æ criteria for responsible production. But in combination, they address all relevant issues throughout our supply chain. Defined and monitored by external organizations, the certificates are our way of making the most sustainable clothing we can. In that way, the certificates are more than just funky looking stamps. They are our guarantee.

We call it Certified Responsibility‚Ñ¢

	‚Ä¢ Fairtrade
	‚Ä¢ GOTS
	‚Ä¢ EU Ecolabel
	‚Ä¢ SA8000
	‚Ä¢ Neutral¬Æ Responsibility
	‚Ä¢ Oeko-Tex

If you need further information or have any questions, please contact us at neutral@neutral.com

Did you know Neutral¬Æ is the winner of CSR Abroad 2015 and Sustainia Fashion 2013? Read more at www.neutral.com

We are called ‚ÄòFeel Good Company‚Äô as it reflects our outlook on life, as well as our business strategy. 

We believe that if you eat well, you will feel good. And that is exactly why our food bars are made from the very best raw materials, always produced in the highest possible quality.

RATION isn't a regular food bar, but developed by dietitians and athletes. Nutritiously made according to the official dietary guidelines.

This means a healthy, tasty, food snack, full of apple and oats, packed with fiber and whole grain, giving you something to chew, providing stable energy and blood sugar.

So whether you're at work, school, out running or exercising or just hungry, you will experience that RATION is the healthy good for you source of fuel for body and mind.

Our bars are obviously 100 % all natural, no artificial stuff and suitable for vegetarians, just to mention a few extra details.

But to be quite honest, that's not the most interesting bit about us.

Whether it's the quality of our products or a delivery that matters, we always keep our promises and never compromise. 

Our customers benefit from the pure raw materials, the high fiber content and the whole grains that help to provide a really good satiety and maintains a stable blood sugar.

Roughly speaking, anyone who is interested in eating properly and taking care of themselves when they are slightly hungry and do not want to compromise on health.

We are small and agile, independent, ambitious, cheeky, and dedicated to the fingertips. 

We love to laugh. We do not laugh for fun, but because we believe it is a better business when we, our surroundings and our customers are happy.

Yours respectfully

Audientes‚Äô mission is to make quality hearing solutions accessible and affordable to everyone who needs them. In other words, to help hearing-impaired people hear and interact freely. Audientes‚Äô solutions address a large and growing global market. According to the WHO, of the 360 million people worldwide with disabling hearing loss, the needs of less than 10% are currently met. Therefore, while today‚Äôs worldwide market for quality fitted hearing aids is estimated at only 14 million single-ear units annually, our self-fitting solution addresses an important new market, consisting of over 300 million people, many in middle income or developing countries. Our goal is to have sold in excess of one million hearing aids, around the world, by 2025.

Unique design and a great story? Are you sick of hearing the same description used over and over again by seemingly identical watch brands? We were. And that‚Äôs why we created REC.

We wanted to redefine how a timepiece can tell a (fantastic) story, and relate to you not as a customer, but as an individual. Watch fanatics to the bone, we wanted to create something different, unpretentious, and ultimately something we would simply crave ourselves. Hence, instead of some obscure year of establishment or vague ‚Äòinspiration‚Äô, every single REC timepiece is made by salvaging classic cars and icons, and transforming them into watch components ‚Äì a concept which we termed ‚ÄúRECOVER, RECYCLE, RECLAIM‚Äù.

The result? EVERY single REC watch is visually unique ‚Äì that‚Äôs right, no two are identical - include handmade components, and are born with the story from the object of which it was made. Now that‚Äôs what unique design and great stories should mean!

Time to think ‚Ä¶

The year is 2009, and the place is the hometown of world-renowned storyteller H. C. Andersen. 

A businessman, who used to have his hands ‚Äì and mind ‚Äì full, sits down to think. The silence allows his mind to run free. With more than 25 years in the cargo security business, he has met many obstacles; heard every question. He knows just about every challenge.

He thinks of lashing equipment, which hasn‚Äôt changed since its invention. But why?

When it comes to safety and efficiency, there are obvious drawbacks to the existing equipment. For instance, inserting the webbing into the ratchet is a time-consuming process. He knows he can make this process both easier and quicker.

Countless thoughts, ideas, and gadgets see the light of day over the next couple of years. There‚Äôs progress, but also dead ends. Then, in 2016, he‚Äôs got it: a fully functional prototype. It‚Äôs easy to use and both economically and ergonomically superior to the original, so he names it Ergolash¬Æ.  

Determined to transform his prototype into a quality product ready to be used by the demanding cargo industry, he keeps working on it. This innovative version of an old product is sure to attract attention, and the cargo industry will benefit from it. 

Wanting to protect his invention, the businessman applies for a world patent.

Finally, in 2019, he gets his patent. Endless tests prove the worth of Ergolash¬Æ time and time again, and production begins. 

My name is Jackie, and I‚Äôm the businessman in the story. I‚Äôm happy to tell you that Ergolash¬Æ can save you both physical and economic resources.

Krenkerup Brewery is a new and modern part of the old and distinguished Krenkerup Estate near Sakskoebing in Denmark. The estate has, since 1367, been passed on in the same family from generation to generation.

Krenkerup Brewery brews according to the Bavarian law of purity, which is a special brewing method that involves high quality standards for the raw material. This means that no preservatives are used ‚Äì no E numbers, no added enzymes, colors or added sugar. We create quality beer with water, malt, hops, yeast and nothing else!

Great taste for life ‚Äì and beer of a special supreme quality

Atacac is a Swedish based fashion studio founded by Jimmy Herdberg and Rickard Lindqvist. Atacac rethinks the way of design, present and sell garments by challenging every step in the process. 

Rickard Lindqvist is a fashion designer and researcher. His research proposes new foundations, theories and methods for pattern cutting and stretches between blue-skies research and applied projects. Rickard was originally trained as a men's tailor, in addition to studying fashion design at the Swedish School of Textiles from where he also holds a PhD in fashion design. Between 2007 and 2011 he ran the eponymous Rickard Lindqvist fashion label. As a consultant he has served clients such as Vivienne Westwood and Nudie Jeans.

Jimmy Herdberg is the founder of Kokokaka, a creative studio and producers of digital haute couture. Since the beginning of the 21st century Jimmy and his creative team have explored the world between digital and fashion for clients such as Wrangler, Prada, Burberry and Louis Vuitton.

Project Nord is the No. 1 destination for Nordic art prints that transform your home. Our designs are effortlessly stylish and rooted in rich Scandinavian tradition. We also follow Nordic practices by being a sustainably-minded company. 

So, let us bring a touch of Scandinavia into your home!

Our Story

Founded in Copenhagen, Project Nord has a clear vision - to enrich people's lives with stylish, Nordic home decor. We want to create spaces which people can truly relax in. And, that includes limiting our impact on the planet. Wondering how?

Small, thoughtful changes, like our posters, can make a huge difference to a space. In fact, something as simple as a poster can boost your happiness, productivity, and inner peace! We even plant a tree in your name for every poster you buy from us. That means your posters are having an effect in the wider world too!


Our Product

Our Nordic-inspired designs are created by artists from around the world! They are beautiful to look at, but also serve a purpose: they transform the spaces they're displayed in. Our posters are the perfect minimalist touch. Less really is more!

Our Nordic and minimalistic mindsets are also reflected in our attitude to resources. We are mindful about how our effect on the planet. Which is why we plant a tree for every poster you buy from us. It's that simple!

Based on more than fifty years of experience, Graae Copenhagen has accumulated a unique knowledge of hides, tanning, colouring, cutting and construction of leather goods.

The Graae quality
Leather craftsmanship created with passion for uncompromising quality.

First and foremost, we select the best hides and skin. We have always worked with some of the best tanneries in the world, including Italian tannery Tempesti through which we buy vegetable tanned and aniline dyed calfskin. This kind of leather is tanned from natural plant extracts such as oak bark, rhubarb,eucalyptus and acacia bark. Using the highest quality of skins, we make sure that our products patinate beautifully and stay with our customers for years. Another central component is the hardware we use, including belt buckles, hinges and locks. These are all our own design and all made from solid brass which is plated with silver and palladium. Plating with palladium on top of the silver secure that the hardware will maintain the same look, even after many years of daily use.

Design
A Graae product is characterised by functionality, quality and a timeless design that can stand the test of time. We cater to the classic - yet modern - man who is focused on product quality rather than logos. In everything we do, we strive to design leather goods that will stay with you for a lifetime.

Meet Raging Pig - a revolution within bacon that lets you enjoy the taste that you love in a healthy, sustainable and cruelty-free way. 

We‚Äôve set out on an exciting journey to merge the power of bacon, foodtech and pop culture to drive the positive change our world needed yesterday.

Treat yourself with a deep breath and imagine a world with peace. Imagine a world free from  hate, no matter where you‚Äôre born or who you happen to fall in love with. Imagine a world without gender, social or economic inequality. Imagine a world where no human needs to starve. Imagine a world  where all species live in harmony. Imagine a world that makes Mother Nature proud again. Sounds lovely, doesn‚Äôt it?

So, will Raging Pig Company make this Utopia become reality? Most definitely not.

However, the birth of Raging Pig Company will let us humans enjoy the delicious taste of bacon without having to be a part of the, not so delicious, pig slaughtering circus ending the life of 1.5 billion life-loving pigs every year. And that‚Äôs at least a pretty decent starting point, don‚Äôt you think?

Eager to join the revolution? We have an open door-policy for amazing people who want to contribute to our mission in any way. Don‚Äôt hesitate to reach out!

companyName: Mifuko - Work of hands and hearts
description:
WORK OF HANDS AND HEARTS
Mifuko is a Finnish design company that combines Finnish design with traditional Kenyan handicrafts. The company's product range includes baskets, bags and home decor items. 

As a Guaranteed WFTO member Mifuko adheres to the highest ethical requirements. This means the products you are getting are made in compliance with the 10 Principles of Fair Trade, which covers human and labour rights, as well as the buying and management processes that enable this.

The baskets are already made by more than 700 artisans and sold in about 30 countries.

MIFUKO MEANS POCKET

The word mifuko means pocket in Swahili. We make sure that everyone gets something in their pocket. Mifuko¬¥s partner workshops and self-help groups employ many underprivileged, such as slum youth and people with disabilities or economically disadvantaged rural backgrounds. 

Our products bring joy and happiness to both their makers in Kenya and their users around the globe.

MIFUKO TRUST

Mifuko is founder of a charity association Mifuko Trust which aims to bring everyday life-enhancing improvements to rural women: an area where clean water is a luxury and there is no electricity. In just 8 years, Mifuko Trust has built dry toilets, bought rainwater tanks and donated solar lights to the artisan women‚Äôs communities in the area.

ReRobe AB is a retail and technology company based in Stockholm, Sweden. We were founded in 2019 on the belief that everyone should sustainably enjoy fashion, and our mission is to help people discover the joy of a circular shopping experience.

At our core, we focus on building tech-driven solutions that enable businesses and consumers to participate in the circular economy. 

For consumers, we serve them through our online and physical stores, all powered by our own web, mobile and hardware technologies. Our flagship store in S√∂dermalm combines a physical and digital shopping experience designed for the modern consumer to discover, shop, and sell ‚Äúpre-loved‚Äù fashion. 

For businesses, we are building innovative e-commerce and retail technology that will help them run an omni-channel business geared toward the resale economy. Our vision is to help businesses turn retail into re-sale, e-commerce into re-commerce, and consumption into conservation.

We don‚Äôt like to think of ourselves as operating within one vertical or niche. Instead, our vision is to set the standard for a new model of sustainable consumption, and we are doing it in partnership with consumers, brands, retailers, and department stores.

We're a hardworking, but fun-loving, team of software engineers, creatives, marketing pros, retail experts, and entrepreneurs who care about our planet, our communities, and conscious capitalism.

Download ReRobe today on the App or Play store and discover a whole new way to shop and sell pre-loved fashion. Follow us on Instagram @rerobestockholm for news, updates, and new feature announcements.

AMOV is a new apparel brand for women and men. We will make it natural and easy to make sustainable choices when you shop for your new favorite wardrobe items.

Background:
We are at a point in history where it is fully possible for every living being to live a good life.

But what we are seeing is gross inequality, poverty, conflict and a breakdown of our fragile ecosystem. Even in the richest, most peaceful parts of the world, people are stressed out and far from being as happy as they could be.

We have come to look at the world through lenses of scarcity. We believe that in order for us to win someone has to lose.

This belief is deeply rooted in us, so we come to see getting and giving as mutually exclusive: You either chase your own happiness or your sacrifice your chance of success to help others.

But we are misguided. Surely there is a middle ground. Surely it is possible to create a healthy balance between doing good for ourselves and doing good for others.

AMOV will prove our old scripts wrong. We will show how success is best measured in human values, rather than just shareholder value, profit and GDP.
We will prove that happiness can come from balancing all things; especially getting and giving. 

Tackling a notoriously non-sustainable industry; we are creating an apparel brand. Through our work and example, we wish to start a movement. A movement towards a society where people, businesses and politicians find it natural to act responsibly and with compassion.

"Profit matching" is our way of balancing our financial success with our responsibility to give back; to do good in the world. Specifically it means that for every penny we earn (after taxes and interest) we must at least raise a similar amount for doing good through various activities, campaigns, funds, what not...

Read all about it on www.amovapparel.com

Superclub AS is a one-game game studio from Norway. We‚Äôre determined to make the best football manager board game in the World. 

Superclub combines match day tactics with big picture decisions to give you football on every scale. Affaldssortering skal v√¶re nemt og overskueligt for at fungere i hverdagen. ReCollector er et dansk designet system til affaldssortering og kan udvides efter behov. ReCollector fremstilles i Danmark af genanvendeligt pp plast og kan genanvendes.

SOLUTION
We bring real time underwater camera vision and insight on the biomass through cutting edge and affordable technology to the global aquaculture industry. We do real time in-situ monitoring on vital parameters of the entire biomass throughout the grow out period. 

Our products are easy to install, zero touch sensor products embedded with affordable Industry 4.0 technology, such as Artificial Intelligence, Computer Vision and Machine Learning. They are built to gather data on the biomass when it goes from nursery to grow out and 24/7/ monitoring throughout the entire grow out cycle. This will provide invaluable, real-time data, enabling the individual farms to get early warnings, accurate survival rates and the exact optimal time to harvest. 

MISSION
Our mission is to collect, monitor, analyze and present vital parameters on underwater biomass to enable farmers to be more efficient and help accelerate the land based protein production towards aquaculture species.

Bubblebee Industries is Making Sound Sound Better by creating the world‚Äôs best quality microphone wind protection and other innovative sound accessories for serious sound professionals. Field recording often means capturing sound in very challenging environments and Bubblebee‚Äôs windscreens are designed to be good looking, easy to use and technically second to none to retain as much of the microphone‚Äôs natural sound as possible.

Bubblebee Industries'‚Äã founder and designer Poul Mejer is a veteran field recorder for TV productions all over the world. On creating the Bubblebee windshields, Mejer says, ‚ÄúIt has always been my passion to produce, channel and enjoy the best possible sound. I had to make my own lavalier windbubbles since the ones available on the market were not good enough, unattractive and a bit fiddly to use.‚Äù

Along with the Windbubbles, Bubblebee also makes other innovative products for sound designers, like the new Invisible Lav Covers, The Cable Saver and The Windkiller.

At Silkeborg Uldspinderi, wool is our foundation. We have worked with wool for three generations. From the lightest and softest qualities to heavy and warm Scandinavian wool; as well as from raw wool to the finished product.

Silkeborg Uldspinderi was established in 1987, but our know-how with regard to the material goes all the way back to the late 1940s when the spinning mill that later formed the basis of Silkeborg Uldspinderi was founded. 

Today, the old wool spinning mill is transformed into a modern Danish design brand with a focus on fine craftsmanship and sustainable design in both wool and alpaca.

The founders of Medanta were united by their desire to create something better and by their strong belief in the importance of beautiful clothes in demanding professions. In our opinion, clothes in the health care industry needed freshening up. We wanted to add performance features to professional clothing and even more powerful design know-how.

The development work undertaken utilised the technical innovations in sportswear textiles. By carefully mapping our clients' needs and bringing together a selected circle of experts, it enabled us to produce our own materials. Today, Medanta Flex and Medanta Knit embody the very pinnacle of textile technology.

With our work, we aim to promote the well-being of people working in demanding tasks. Our work has meaning if we can make our client's work easier, more comfortable and aesthetically pleasing.

Our target is to produce workwear so that the environmental strain that they cause during their life cycle is as small as possible. Quality, product safety and the transparency of the production process are the cornerstones of responsibility.

We dare to think differently. We dare to challenge technology. We dare to fail and our comfort zone has expanded. We have developed the first elastic technical material to endure the industrial laundering. 

We have also created workwear collection which is motivating, it increases employee's commitment and improves the atmosphere at work. A trendy, functional work outfit creates a recognisable professional identity.

Today the competitors are trying to copy our desing and material. It is an honour. The world needs pioneers. It also means that the old traditional bulk is finally history. At the moment our design and development team is working with fresh ideas. We are happy to tell you soon more about antibacterial, wrinkle free and oil/dirt resistance coverings in Medanta Flex.

Work won't flow unless the workwear lets the professional flow with it.

Playfinity assembled in 2016 to become a force for good - realizing the global crisis on play, the decline in sports participation, and the growing physical and mental health concerns amongst children.

We're developing products, technology, and experiences that inspire, motivate, and connect children, coaches, parents, families, friends, and teammates around the world - providing new ways to discover, play, compete, and have fun together based on the sports they love.

Our ambition at Playfinity is to be the category leader in an emerging real-world gaming segment - combining gaming, sports, and physical activity in new and innovative ways.  

Putting the player in the center of the physical game - we‚Äôve created fully-immersive experiences, with sound effects, music and live commentary - play by play.

The experiences that we create are built on our proprietary playOS platform combining sensors and mobile technology. playOS is designed as a system for repeatable development, allowing us to scale faster and cheaper for every new sport. Through this we‚Äôre targeting the 1.5+ Billion people playing sports, the $173B gaming industry, and the $388B sports industry.

Through partnerships in 2020 we launched Jump Games in Europe and in 2021 we followed up with Jump League in Australia - both trampoline inspired. 

In Fall of 2021 we launched the Backyard League Gaming Baseball in the United States, appealing to 24+ million players, 96% of whom are kids between the ages of 6-14 years. In the 2 months post-launch the Gaming Baseball earned #1 status for the holiday on Amazon Launchpad and was featured in Newsweek as the #2 technology gift for the holiday 2021.

Join Team Playfinity on our mission to impact millions of lives in youth sports!

What makes us different? 
Buchardt Audio is a Danish based high-end loudspeaker manufacturer. Our goal is to provide state-of-the-art sound at an affordable price. We have succeeded in this task with the help of some of the most talented developers and engineers in the industry. Our speakers are the product of a long and meticulous design process.

Don't let the cost of our speakers dissuade you. They can compete with products well above their price range.

Reaching these prices without compromise is impossible. If compromises on the product and development processes are not an option, we need to look elsewhere. We have eliminated expensive marketing, distributors, agents and Hi-Fi dealers. By selling directly to the end user, we eliminate about 60-70% of the cost in comparison to our competitors. Direct sales is not anything new. More and more small companies are doing this. What makes us different is that we rely on big scale production where we produce thousands of speakers in batches, so we benefit from the best possible prices on the parts we use.    

Our focus is purely on consistent performance and quality. To achieve this, we outsource production to a company that knows what it‚Äôs doing, and can handle the large scale production we need. The company is the respected Danish/Chinese-owned Company: Hansong in Nanjing, China. Hansong has extensive experience in manufacturing for some of the most well known High-End Hi-Fi brands in the world! 

To us, it is of vital importance that the production facility we use offers the best working conditions for the employees. Hansong offers special healthcare benefits to all employees along with apartments and free electric bus rides to the city. Hansong is ISO 9001 certified and has facilities in China, Denmark and USA.

Our products are finally shipped to our warehouse in Denmark where we do an final quality control before shipping to our customers.

Ion Game Design (ION) is a Swedish board game developer, publisher & board game consultant agency. We believe in the potential of boardgames as and art form, an excellent form of social relations and a creative tool. Since 2018 we also publish all Phil Eklund's games under the label Sierra Madre Games (SMG). Together we develop educational boardgames covering a broad range of subjects in science, history, prehistory, and natural history.
 
There are the three main divisions in the product portfolio of Ion Game Design:

ION:SMG - Under this label we mainly make ‚Äúheavier‚Äù historical & scientific board games in the ‚Äúhobby‚Äù category.

ION:LIGHT - Under this label we publish our lighter games, geared towards family settings, with a lesser degree of complexity, without loosing the inspiration from reality in our designs.

ION:VENTURE - We will from time to time work with potential projects alongside our main labels. This can be:
- Partnerships with other board game developers and developers of digital games.
- Consultancy in (board) game design.
- Development of games outside our two main focus areas.
- Game related activities such as fairs, conventions, competitions, demonstrations to promote it‚Äôs games and generally expand the hobby.
- Business ideas that does not necessarily include game design but that do include games :)

Mehta Heino Industries Oy was founded in 2015 with the aim to develop new, cost- effective and easy-to-use 3D printers, together with an excellent user experience. We believe that 3D Printing is a tool that can be used everywhere by everyone.

The company‚Äôs first product, MHI3D Printer is a 3D printer based on new solutions developed by us, based on existing FFF/FDM technology. Learning to use MHI3D Printer takes only few minutes and it saves machine users time and effort with industrial level build quality and no daily adjustments needed.

The machine‚Äôs high-end technical solutions helps to solve 3D printing problems faced with average priced desktop 3D Printers (such as bed levelling & nozzle calibration). MHI3D Printer combines reliable industrial 3D Printing experience with easy to use, affordable technology that fits on the desktop. It creates a new era of high-quality desktop-sized 3D-printing for filament-based 3D Printer machines

For your application, MHI3D Printer saves time and effort and enables you to focus on ideas, design and utilisation of parts time and again.
Our printers helps to keep project costs affordable and bridges desktop- manufacturing to industrial level 3D printers. It's the perfect fit for repeating commercial work or for accurate prototyping parts.

For example, MHI3D Printer can be used to quickly build prototypes and test ideas immediately in product development. It is able to make small series production without difficulty test R&D parts on a small scale faster than ever before. The parts produced by the machine are interchangeable, accurate and constant quality.

Climate change is an ever-present threat to the well-being of the world at large and societies all over the world. We are Riot Innovations.

About Soley Organics.
The woman behind S√≥ley Organics is Icelandic actress S√≥ley El√≠asd√≥ttir, a long-standing iconic figure of the country‚Äôs theatre and film world. Now she has left the stage to embrace a family tradition that goes back 16 generations: harnessing the healing properties of herbs. Following in the footsteps of her great grandmother, S√≥ley created S√≥ley Organics in 2007 and launched her first product, an all-purpose therapeutic cream called GR√Ü√êIR, which means ‚Äòhealer‚Äô in Icelandic.
 
Philosophy.
Guided by tradition and the therapeutic qualities of wild Icelandic herbs, S√≥ley Organics strives to deliver pure products inspired by nature. From the integrity of our ingredients to the expertise we pass on to our customers, at S√≥ley Organics we are passionate about healthy skin and dedicated to keeping the environment pure.
 
Environment. 
Iceland‚Äôs nature is our legacy, and we are dedicated to reducing our environmental impact. There is always room for improvement ‚Äì and the more we strive to improve, the more we contribute.
 
Finest ingredients. 
Our premium quality ingredients are 100% natural, safe and ecologically friendly. As a result, our products are free from parabens, preservatives, artificial colours and fragrances, phthalates, propylene glycol, mineral oils, PABA, petrolatum, paraffin or any other chemical agents that can harm man or nature.

Exclusive, handwoven cushion covers, throws, and blankets designed in collaboration with women in underserved communities worldwide.

Kinship Collective works together with female artisans to co-create and co-produce uniquely designed, handwoven cushion covers, throws and blankets which reflect and lift their local cultures and communities. These products are handwoven in a sustainable, ethical process and they are designed and sewn in collaboration with women in vulnerable and underserved communities worldwide.  

Kinship provides market access for these products via our global marketplace, www.kinship-collective.com - where our products will be available for sale to customers worldwide.

Additionally, Kinship ensures that the artisans are working in ethical working conditions and that they are paid directly and fairly for the work that they do. We actively engage them in the design/production process. And then, Kinship, with customer involvement and support, gives back to the community via our platform, Kinship Foundation, in order to optimize the possibility of long term success and potential for the women, their communities and their families. 

Our mission is to keep the artisans continuously employed, and to support them to not only live above the poverty line, but to be empowered to further develop their abilities and skills and create their own opportunities for personal and economic growth. 

Our Business Model allows us to create long term change through the delivery of social impact programmes for the artisans which are funded by donations from Kinship Collective to Kinship Foundation.

Welcome to Kinship Collective.
Conscious design for Intentional Living.

We make feltpads for furnitures directly from the materials of tennis & padel balls. We collect the balls from padel and tennis clubs all over europe. Dots felt pads for furniture is the best solution when it comes to sustainable living and high quality materials. Our felt pads protects your floors from scratches. The rubber is shock-absorbing and gives the felt pad strength and durability. While the thick layer of felt slides easily and noise-free on all surfaces, thus protecting the floor from scratches.  

It all began back in 2020 with a curious heart, a love for Tennis and a passion for sustainable design. Tennis was at the time becoming a big part of our lives, but the more we played, the more we started to question the sustainability of the sport. After a little research, we found out that every year more than 300 million tennis balls are produced, used and thrown away. We had to do something, or at least try, if we wanted to continue playing our favorite sport with a clear conscience.¬†

We quickly connected the Dots (pun intended)! and soon after the first Dots were created. Now we collect padel and tennisballs from all over Europe and making them into Dots felt pads. We've teamed up with the Danish automation company BILA A/S who help us optimize our production by means of automation solutions.
We champion a lifestyle in sync with your female biology, for women to feel their best no matter what day of the month.

Oialla chocolate is an organic Danish award-winning chocolate, made from wild cocoa beans. The cocoa trees grow in Mid and South America in the Amazon region. Master Chocolatier Rasmus Bo Bojesen and Pernille L√ºzth√∏ft founded the company in 2010.

Danish Ministry of Foreign Affairs support the project and Oialla work closely together with the Bolivian cocoa company, Sumar. The production is controlled all the way from cocoa beans to chocolate bars. The partnership secures fair wages, higher living standards and education of the indigenous population in rural Middle America and the Amazon region.

The production of Oialla contributes to improvement of education of the indigenous population in the jungle, where the cocoa beans used for Oialla grow.

Our products are all pure, organic and made without any additives. Visit our webshop for more information and purchase.

Unlock your unlimited wardrobe with Stilrent. Browse our selection and pick the outfits you would like to rent. Delivery, return & dry cleaning is included - now it's up to you to chose your favorite dress to rent! 

Stilrent also offer a selection of carefully curated accessories for sale from selected partners. 

OUR VISION
Fashion is fun and meant to be for everyone regardless of age, budget, size & style. Fashion is our way of expressing ourselves but should also not have to be something that compromises on our environmental and ethical values. We at Stilrent want to offer an easy, fun, environmentally friendly and affordable way of renting clothes & accessories to make fashion accessible for everyone.

 

OUR APPROACH
Sustainability is the very core of our business, and something we are not willing to compromise on. By renting instead of purchasing, we are providing an alternative option where we are increasing the life length of the clothes, fighting against fast-fashion and making sure that the clothes are taken care of like they should and spreading joy to multiple people instead of being left hanging in the back corner of a closet and forgotten about.

 

BEHIND THE SCENES
Stilrent was founded in 2020 by Ivonne Ruiz Olate & Erica Nieminen, two young entrepreneurs with the vision of changing the fashion industry for the good. The team is reinforced by Amy & Carolina, two fashionistas interning at Stilrent .

Incell is an interdisciplinary team of 13 students, representing the University of Copenhagen in the international iGEM competition 2017.  
Incell investigates the molecular mechanisms in endosymbiotic cell-relationships. The team applies a new bottom up approach to the field of current research, by individually studying three essential properties, necessary for a stable endosymbiotic relationship; protein-transport from the host cell to endosymbiont, the dependency between host cell and endosymbiont, and the control of a number of endosymbionts within the host cell. 
The aim is to establish a platform for future artificial endosymbiosis, which can have many applications in the medical-, synthetic biology-, and agricultural industry.

Bau Design is a Danish design studio established in 2016 by Spanish architect Santiago Bautista.

Bau design appears in a climate of extreme consumerism where big brands are inviting the customers to buy new products every season. As a result, the quality of the products is dropping significantly to make them cheaper and less durable, promoting the idea of disposable products. 

Our goal is to design, produce and sell beautiful and durable products manufactured under fair labor conditions and market them at a price which aligns with the intrinsic value of the object.

We control the whole process, from concept sketches to packaging. This is the only way to ensure that our products deliver our identity and values.

COBAGS was founded in 2014 in Copenhagen, the bicycle capital of the world. With 62% of all trips in Copenhagen being made on a bicycle, COBAGS released the first tote shopping bag ‚Äì the BIKEZAC ‚Äì made to fit onto the luggage carrier of the bicycle.

The BIKEZAC is an innovative shopping bag, made of recycled woven PP, a solid and sustainable material. However, its special feature is its innovative, patented mounting rail. Thanks to it, the shopping bag can be attached to a bicycle's luggage rack with only 2 clicks, making shopping by bike easier and safe.

With the three buzzwords #convenient, #ecofriendly and #safe in mind, we have worked hard over the last few years to refine the idea of the BIKEZAC and improve and optimize its design. 
More than satisfied with the current solution, we now focus on making the alternative shopping bag accessible in Denmark and other European countries. 

We are convinced that the BIKEZAC is an innovative alternative for single use plastic bags. Yet, in order to have a positive effect on the preservation of the environment, many individuals have to choose the sustainable way. To make the BIKEZAC easily accessible, we are continuously expanding our network of retailers. Besides that, we are collaborating with various companies that customize the BIKEZAC  with their logo. Together, we can change the world of disposable plastic bags.

For the future we are full of exciting ideas and thus curious to discover where the COBAGS journey will take us.

Nordic Heat is an independent peer-to-peer training, advisory, resource pooling and business innovation service aiming to support the development of District Energy, Energy from Waste and Waste Management solutions in Europe and beyond.

Nordic Heat was founded in 2014 by a group of municipality owned energy operators in Sweden, all with more than 50 years of experience in installing and operating profitable district energy schemes in a deregulated energy market. The role of Nordic Heat is to assist project teams in securing the swift implementation of high performing, reliable and competitive waste management solutions while minimising investment levels, operational costs and risks. A wider objective is to optimising the commercial, social, environmental and political benefits of investments in sustainable energy. Nordic Heat also aims to actively facilitating efficient exchange of competences, experiences and new innovative technologies and practices, thereby strengthening the overall competitiveness of the sector. The Nordic energy operators involved in Nordic Heat have realised that the activity offers an opportunity not only to share experiences, but also to learn from peers abroad who in some respects are more advanced in application of new technologies and business practices, not least in the digital area. Additionally, having an international outlook has also proved to be beneficial in the process of recruiting and developing talented staff.

www.nordic-heat.eu/

Bij Schoonmakend Nederland zijn bijna 300 leden aangesloten die samen 70% van de markt realiseren. Zij zijn actief in schoonmaak van gebouwen, glazenwassen, gevelbehandeling, calamiteitenschoonmaak en reiniging in de voedingsmiddelenindustrie. In de branche werken 125.000 mensen, waarvan 100.000 bij leden van Schoonmakend Nederland.

De leden van Schoonmakend Nederland willen zich nadrukkelijk onderscheiden van bedrijven die het niet zo nauw nemen met de regels. Vandaar dat voor hen het Keurmerk Schoon verplicht is. Het keurmerk garandeert opdrachtgevers dat zij te maken hebben met bedrijven die de cao naleven en die staan voor kwaliteit, betrouwbaarheid en goed werkgeverschap. Ook geldt voor leden de Code Verantwoordelijk Marktgedrag, waarin is vastgelegd dat alle betrokken partijen bij aanbestedingen niet alleen kijken naar de prijs, maar ook kwaliteit van de uitvoering en de arbeidsomstandigheden moeten worden meegewogen. Daarmee geven de leden een helder en duidelijk signaal af: niet alleen de prijs telt, maar vooral kwaliteit staat voorop. Glas- en gevelreinigers kunnen daarboven op nog het keurmerk Glas & Gevel halen waarmee zij aantonen aam specifieke veiligheidseisen te voldoen.

Alle leden worden jaarlijks door een onafhankelijke inspectie instelling getoetst. In het overzicht bedrijven met Keurmerk Schoon staan alle bedrijven die aan de keurmerkeisen voldoen en bij Schoonmakend Nederland zijn aangesloten.

We build sports clubs in refugee camps and create sportswear to grow our club of supporters.

KLABU is a young organisation based mainly in Amsterdam, a social start-up with a scalable business model to power positive change.

The KLABU Foundation builds and operates our sports clubs on a non-profit basis. The Foundation is funded primarily through donations from institutions and private individuals, and proceeds from the sale of KLABU sportswear. 

The development and sale of KLABU sportswear is carried out by our social enterprise KLABU B.V. Developing and selling KLABU products gives us a level of independence to become a healthy organisation with long-term impact. Half the profits from sales go to the KLABU Foundation to maintain our sports clubs in refugee camps. The other half are reinvested to increase our brand‚Äôs impact. 

We invite everyone to join the club and support the unbeatable spirit at www.klabu.org.

Anyone can learn to program. We are convinced of that! Learning to work with code is becoming increasingly important. The tech industry is growing enormously, as a result of which the demand for people with the right skills is growing faster than the supply. With an innovative way of teaching, we ensure that our students develop these necessary skills. We train developers to start working immediately and teach professionals how to perform their work more efficiently with the help of (low/no-) code tools.

Winc Academy makes learning to program accessible to everyone by offering remote training courses, which you can start right away. All courses can be followed at your own pace and without any specific prior education. Despite this flexible approach, we find it important that Winc remains personal. We know our students and you know us and your fellow students! Learning (online) together is much more fun and instructive than alone.

Winc was founded in 2018 as a 100% remote school, so remote learning is in our DNA. We do not believe that it is enough to put a camera on a teacher and have everyone log in at home via a video conferencing tool. Remote teaching is much more than that. For example, how do you build a teaching program so students do not lose their attention? Or how do we ensure that we stay in touch with each other? How do we achieve a learning goal together? And how do we know if you really get it?

We've spent a lot of love and attention on all of these themes, and continue to do so on a daily basis. Because of this, our model has continued to improve in recent years.

Out of love and necessity rather than profit and novelty, Patta opened its doors in 2004. Situated right in the city heart of Amsterdam, the store literally became the center of attention by bringing new excitement to the Dutch street wear scene.

Founded by Edson Sabajo and Guillaume ‚ÄòGee‚Äô Schmidt as a means to provide themselves, as well as their friends and family with a steady supply of footwear and gear, that which has started as a hobby, has now flourished into a thriving business and recognizable brand. Both prominent figures in the Dutch Hip-Hop scene in the 90‚Äôs and early 2000‚Äôs, Edson as a DJ and Gee as host/MC, it was these common interests that grew into a strong friendship and viable business partnership.

Before the Tier 0, Quickstrike and Consortium accounts, the team traveled across the planet with wads of cash in their pockets, visiting obscure sneaker stores and buying vast amounts of footwear that was unavailable to the Dutch public. Without any shipping accounts or even knowledge of the like, they either posted huge boxes of shoes back to their hometown, or they threw them in big duffelbags and try to bring them back on the plane. This unwavering determination to make success happen, the just-do-it-yourself mentality and the willingness to go against the grain are the foundation of Patta's identity.

Aside from footwear staples such as Nike, adidas, Converse, ASICS, Reebok, KangaROOS, New Balance and Diadora, you can also find products from brands like St√ºssy, Rockwell and Patta's in-house brand and more.

When Patta started out, the logo was used to make a small batch of t-shirts for friends, family and loyal customers. As demand was higher than expected, more were made and eventually evolved into our in-house brand. Starting out small with a capsule in the summer of 2011 available at five retailers worldwide, the collection has grown exponentially in size, quality and availability with 15 retailers stocking the brand.
